medullula: <entryFree id="n28384" type="main" key="me^dullu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕdullŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
medullus: <entryFree id="n28385" type="main" key="Medullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Medullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:50" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
medulus: <entryFree id="n28386" type="main" key="Me^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Meduli.</entryFree>
medus: <entryFree id="n28387" type="main" key="Me_dus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Medi, II. A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28388" type="main" key="Me_dus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Ægeus and Medea; the title of a tragedy of Pacuvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28389" type="main" key="Me_dus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mh=dos</foreign>, <sense id="n28389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river of Persia, a tributary of the Araxes, now the Polwar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl>; v. also Medi.</sense></entryFree>
medusa: <entryFree id="n28390" type="main" key="Me^du_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/dousa</foreign>, <sense id="n28390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Phorcus; she captivated Neptune with her golden hair, and became by him the mother of Pegasus. Minerva, as a punishment, turned her hair into serpents, and gave to her eyes an enchanted power of converting everything they looked upon to stone. Perseus, provided with the shield of Pallas, slew her, and carried off her head, while from the blood that dropped from it serpents sprung</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 654</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">793</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 626</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28390.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕdūsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Medusa, Medusan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praepes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the fount Hippocrene, struck open by a blow of the hoof of Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 312</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mefitis: <entryFree id="n28391" type="main" key="Me^fi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕfītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Mephitis, II.</entryFree>
megabocchus: <entryFree id="n28392" type="main" key="Me^ga^bocchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăbocchus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-boccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> —Caius, <sense id="n28392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prætor in Sardinia</hi>, Cic. Scaur. § 40; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 3</bibl> Orell. <cb n="MEGA" /></sense></entryFree>
megabyzus: <entryFree id="n28393" type="main" key="Me^ga^byzus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăbyzus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mega/buzos</foreign>. <sense id="n28393.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A priest of Diana at Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28393.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Darius's generals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28393.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Persian eunuch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megaera: <entryFree id="n28394" type="main" key="Me^gaera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgaera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/gaira</foreign>. <sense id="n28394.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 846</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 387</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28394.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megaera quaedam mortalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
megale: <entryFree id="n28395" type="main" key="Me^ga^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mega/lh</foreign> (the great, exalted), <sense id="n28395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the</hi> Magna Mater, Calend. Verrii Fl. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 389</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>—</sense><sense id="n28395.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n28395.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgă-lensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēsis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28395.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Magna Mater (only postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum Megalesium spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludis Megalensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megalensibus sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 37, § 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28395.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Megalesia, Megalesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megalensis purpura,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the festival dress of the prætor worn at the Megalesia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:41:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 41, 5</bibl></cit>.—Most freq. in <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălensia</orth>, <itype>or, in the archaic form</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēsia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, also Magalesia ludi, <hi rend="ital">the festival in honor of the</hi> Magna Mater, <hi rend="ital">celebrated annually on the</hi> 4<hi rend="ital">th of April with processions and games</hi>: Megalensia, Calend. Praenest. Verrii in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 388</bibl> and 399; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.; v. also Müll. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=400 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 400 sq.</bibl>; and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi haec ipsis Megalensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertulere deam (Magnam Matrem) pridie Idus Aprilis: isque dies festus fuit: populus frequens dona deae in Palatium tulit lectisterniumque et ludi fuere, Megalesia appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Harusp. 12, 24: Megalesia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megalesia ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:357" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 357</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28395.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Megalesia, Megalesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 191</bibl></cit>; Schol. Juv. ib.</sense></entryFree>
megalensia: <entryFree id="n28396" type="main" key="Me^ga^lensi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălensĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēsĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălensis</orth>, v. Megale, II. A.</entryFree>
megalepolis: <entryFree id="n28397" type="main" key="Me^ga^le_po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēpŏlis</orth>, v. Megalopolis.</entryFree>
megalesiacus: <entryFree id="n28398" type="main" key="Me^ga^le_si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Megale, II. B.</entryFree>
megalia: <entryFree id="n28399" type="main" key="Me^ga_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgālĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island of Campania</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Castel dell' Ovo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:80" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 80</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Megaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
megalium: <entryFree id="n28400" type="greek" key="me^ga^li_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕgălīum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mĕgallīum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mega/leion</foreign>, <sense id="n28400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ointment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea multo successit propter gloriam appellatum megalium, ex oleo balanino, balsamo, calamo, junco, xylobalsamo, casia, resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
megalographia: <entryFree id="n28401" type="greek" key="me^ga^lo^gra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕgălŏgrăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">megalografi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the painting of large</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grand subjects</hi> (opp. <foreign lang="greek">r(uparografi/a</foreign>, the painting of small subjects), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megalobusus: <entryFree id="n28402" type="main" key="Me^ga^lo^bu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălŏbūsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-byzus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megalo/buzos</foreign>, <sense id="n28402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Theotimus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megalopolis: <entryFree id="n28403" type="main" key="Me^ga^lo^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălē pŏ-lis</orth> (<case>acc.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălēn pŏlin</orth>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megalo/polis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*mega/lh po/lis</foreign>, <sense id="n28403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Arcadia, the birthplace of Polybius</hi>.—Form Megalopolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 28, 4</bibl>.—Form Megale polis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 36, 10</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28403.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălŏpŏlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Megalopolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28403.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgălŏpŏlītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Megalopolis, Megalopolitan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-gălŏpŏlītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Megalopolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megapenthes: <entryFree id="n28404" type="hapax" key="Me^ga^penthes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăpenthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megape/nqhs</foreign>, <sense id="n28404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Prœtus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 244" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megara: <entryFree id="n28405" type="main" key="Me^ga^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Numantine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28406" type="main" key="Me^ga^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n28406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> Megaribus for Megaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 57</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *me/gara</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n28406.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in the country of Megaris, the birthplace of Euclid</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28406.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:43:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 43, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28406.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28406.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgă-ra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a city of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:273" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 273</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 1, 55</bibl>; v. Megaris, II.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28407" type="main" key="Me^ga^ra3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wife of Hercules, whom, in his madness, he destroyed, together with her children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 31" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 31</bibl>. <cb n="MELA" /></sense></entryFree>
megareius: <entryFree id="n28408" type="main" key="Me^ga^re_i^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. Megara</etym>, <sense id="n28408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Megara, Megareian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:219" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28409" type="main" key="Me^ga^re_i^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2. Megareus.</entryFree>
megarensis: <entryFree id="n28410" type="main" key="Me^ga^rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. Megara</etym>, <sense id="n28410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Megara</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicias,</quote> <trans><tr>of Megara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>: homines <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megareus: <entryFree id="n28411" type="main" key="Me^ga^re_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> = <foreign lang="greek">*megarei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n28411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Megara</hi> (in Megaris), <hi rend="ital">Megarean</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Euclides Socratis discipulus, Megareus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28413" type="main" key="Me^ga^reus2" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megareu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Neptune, and father of Hippomenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 157" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 157</bibl> and 185; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 605</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Megareus, Megareian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hippomenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 659</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
megarea: <entryFree id="n28412" type="main" key="Me^ga^re_a" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărēa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, for <sense id="n28412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Megara</hi> (a city of Sicily), or for <hi rend="ital">Megarensia</hi>, sc. arva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:471" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 471</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megaricus: <entryFree id="n28414" type="main" key="Me^ga^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megariko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Megara, Megaric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megaricus sinus,</quote> <trans><tr>a part of the Saronic Gulf, near Megara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of marble from Megara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 2</bibl>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, sc. philosophi, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Euclid</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megaris: <entryFree id="n28415" type="main" key="Me^ga^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megari/s</foreign>. <sense id="n28415.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A country of Greece, between Attica and Phocis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28415.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Sicily, also called</hi> Megara, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megarus: <entryFree id="n28416" type="main" key="Me^ga^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. Megara</etym>, <sense id="n28416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Megara, Megarean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 689</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
megas: <entryFree id="n28417" type="main" key="Me^gas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/gas</foreign>, <sense id="n28417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname;</hi> e. g. Demetrius Megas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 36, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meges: <entryFree id="n28418" type="main" key="Me^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕges</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/ghs</foreign>, <sense id="n28418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Phyleus, one of Helen's suitors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megistanes: <entryFree id="n28419" type="greek" key="me^gista_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕgistānes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">megista=nes</foreign> <sense id="n28419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the grandees</hi> of a kingdom, <hi rend="ital">the magnates</hi> who were in the king's suite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
megiste: <entryFree id="n28420" type="greek" key="Me^giste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgistē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megi/sth</foreign>, <sense id="n28420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name given to slaves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 189</bibl>, n. 433.</sense></entryFree>
megisto: <entryFree id="n28421" type="main" key="Me^gisto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕgistō</orth>, <itype>ūs, or ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*megistw/</foreign>, <sense id="n28421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Ceteus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mehe: <entryFree id="n28422" type="gloss" key="mehe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mehe</orth>, <itype>for me</itype>, v. ego <sense id="n28422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mehercle: <entryFree id="n28423" type="main" key="mehercle"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mehercle</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mehercŭle</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">me-hercŭles</orth>, v. Hercules.</entryFree>
meio: <entryFree id="n28424" type="main" key="me_io"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēio</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>for migio, kindred with Sanscr. mih, effundere; whence also mingo; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)mixe/w, o)mi/xlh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n28424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer est locus, extra Meiite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:114" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HOSPES AD HVNC TVMVLVM NE MEIAS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4781</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala meiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 131</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a vessel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 13</bibl>.—In a double sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ditior aut formae melioris meiat eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 52</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">caldum meiere et frigidum potare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give more than one receives</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mel: <entryFree id="n28425" type="main" key="me^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕl</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mellis</orth> (<sense id="n28425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> melli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> obsol. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 744</bibl> P.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/li</foreign>, honey; <foreign lang="greek">me/lissa</foreign>, bee; cf. mulsus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">honey</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28425.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est melli dulci dulcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit> (Spengel, dulce): <cit><quote lang="la">villa abundat lacte, caseo, melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">roscida mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis vindemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28425.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">honey</hi> for <hi rend="ital">sweetness, pleasantness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtica mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc juvat et melli est,</quote> <trans><tr>is pleasant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of sweetness, pleasantness of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">Nestoreum mel, Auct. Pan. ad Pison. 64: Homerici senis mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: quia te tango, mel mihi videor lingere,</quote> <trans><tr>it seems to me as sweet as honey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella petere in medio flumine,</quote> <trans><tr>of a vain search</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 748</bibl></cit>. —As a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">darling, sweet, honey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum mel, meum cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 18</bibl>: Sempronium, mel ac delicias tuas, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mela: <entryFree id="n28426" type="main" key="Me^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. from <foreign lang="greek">me/las</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n28426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 3</bibl>: Pomponius Mela, <hi rend="ital">a Roman geographer, a native of Spain, under the emperor Claudius;</hi> v. Teuffel, Röm. Litt. § 291. <pb n="1127" /> <cb n="MELA" /></sense></entryFree>
melae: <entryFree id="n28427" type="main" key="Melae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the Samnite country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Meles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melambium: <entryFree id="n28428" type="main" key="Melambi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melambĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Thessaly, near Scotussa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melamphyllon: <entryFree id="n28429" type="greek" key="me^lamphyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlamphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/mfullon</foreign>, <sense id="n28429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> acanthus <hi rend="ital">and</hi> paederos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 34, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melampodion: <entryFree id="n28430" type="greek" key="me^lampo^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlampŏdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melampo/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n28430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black hellebore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melampsythium: <entryFree id="n28431" type="greek" key="me^lampsythi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlampsythĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melamyu/qion</foreign>, <sense id="n28431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black raisin-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melampus: <entryFree id="n28432" type="main" key="Me^lampu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlampūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mela/mpous</foreign>. <sense id="n28432.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Amythāon, a celebrated physician and soothsayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 550</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:452" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 452</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28432.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Atreus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28432.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melanaetos: <entryFree id="n28433" type="greek" key="me^la^na^e^tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlănăĕtos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melana/etos</foreign>, <sense id="n28433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the black eagle;</hi> a small species of eagle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melanchaetes: <entryFree id="n28434" type="main" key="Me^lanchaetes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlanchaetes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melagxai/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n28434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black-hair</hi>, the name of a dog, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melancholia: <entryFree id="n28435" type="greek" key="me^lancho^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlanchŏlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melagxoli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:12:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 12, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melancholicus: <entryFree id="n28436" type="greek" key="me^lancho^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlanchŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">melagxoliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having black bile, atrabilious, melancholy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles quidem ait, omnes ingeniosos melancholicos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 37, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 64, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertigines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 105, § 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melancoryphos: <entryFree id="n28437" type="main" key="me^lanco^ry^phos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlancŏryphos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melagko/rufos</foreign> (having a black crown), <sense id="n28437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the black cap</hi>, the name of a kind of snipe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>: genus avium, quae Latine vocantur atricapillae, eo, quod summa eorum capita nigra sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124, 15</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melancranis: <entryFree id="n28438" type="greek" key="me^lancra_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlancrānis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/gkranis</foreign> (black-head), <sense id="n28438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rush with black seeds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melandryum: <entryFree id="n28439" type="greek" key="me^landry^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlandryum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/ndruon</foreign>, <sense id="n28439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece of salted tunny-fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterā parte plenis pulpamentis sale asservantur melandrya vocantur, caesis quercus assulis simillima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>like the black heart of oak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:12:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 12, § 77</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
melaneus: <entryFree id="n28440" type="main" key="Me^la^neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlăneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melaneu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n28440.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 306</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28440.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 223</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melania: <entryFree id="n28441" type="greek" key="me^la^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlănĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melani/a</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">me/las</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 19</bibl>), <sense id="n28441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blackness, black spots</hi>, of the skin (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 29, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:149" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 88, § 149</bibl> Sillig. (Jan. malandrias).</sense></entryFree>
melanippe: <entryFree id="n28442" type="main" key="Me^la^nippe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlănippē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melani/pph</foreign>. <sense id="n28442.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Desmon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Æolus, the mother by Neptune of Bœotus and Æolus, the founders of Bœotia and Æolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 186" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melanippas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>. She was the subject of two tragedies; <cit><quote lang="la">by Attius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:3:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 3, § 65</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and by Ennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 229</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28442.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sister of Antiope, queen of the Amazons, taken captive by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:23 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 23 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
melanippus: <entryFree id="n28443" type="main" key="Me^la^nippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlănippus</orth>, v. Menalippus.</entryFree>
melanius: <entryFree id="n28444" type="main" key="Me^la^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlănĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 858, 5.</sense></entryFree>
melanteria: <entryFree id="n28445" type="greek" key="me^lante_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlantērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n28445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> melanterias), = <foreign lang="greek">melanthri/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">blacking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 208" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melanthemum: <entryFree id="n28446" type="greek" key="me^lanthe^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlanthĕmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>, for melanthion.</entryFree>
melantheus: <entryFree id="n28447" type="main" key="Me^lanthe_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlanthēus</orth>, v. Melanthus <sense id="n28447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
melanthium: <entryFree id="n28448" type="greek" key="me^lanthi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlanthĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/nqion</foreign>, <sense id="n28448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> gith, <hi rend="ital">cultivated fennel-flower</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gith e Graecis alii melanthion, alii melaspermon, vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 182</bibl></cit>; Col. poët. 10, 245; also <hi rend="ital">chamomile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlanthum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melanthius: <entryFree id="n28449" type="main" key="Me^lanthi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlanthĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mela/nqios</foreign>. <sense id="n28449.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A goatherd of Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28449.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 32, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:76" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 36, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melantho: <entryFree id="n28450" type="main" key="Me^lantho_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlanthō</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melanqw/</foreign>, <sense id="n28450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seanymph, daughter of Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 120</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 373</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melanthum: <entryFree id="n28451" type="main" key="me^lanthum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlanthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. melanthium <sense id="n28451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
melanthus: <entryFree id="n28452" type="main" key="Me^lanthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlanthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/lanqos</foreign>. <sense id="n28452.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <cb n="MELE" /> <hi rend="ital">river in Sarmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28452.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the seamen whom Bacchus changed into dolphins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 617</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28452.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of the Athenian king Codrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlanthēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Melanthus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:625" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 625</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melantias: <entryFree id="n28453" type="main" key="Melanti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melantĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melantia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thrace, between the Propontis and the Pontus Euxinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melanurus: <entryFree id="n28454" type="greek" key="me^la^nu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlănūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/nouros</foreign> (black-tail), <sense id="n28454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 7 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:113" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 8, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melapium: <entryFree id="n28455" type="greek" key="me_la^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlăpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhla/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n28455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apple-pear</hi>, a kind of apple resembling a pear (al. melapia, melappia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melas: <entryFree id="n28456" type="main" key="Me^las1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlas</orth>, <itype>ănis and ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/las</foreign> (black). <sense id="n28456.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several rivers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28456.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Bœotia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mavropotami</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:273" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28456.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kavatch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 40, 5</bibl>; Mela, 2, 2, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28456.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nocito</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorumque Melan pascua laeta boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:476" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 476</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28456.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Cappadocia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jochmah Su</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28456.5" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28456.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Phryxus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 3" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28456.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Etruscan seamen whom Bacchus changed into dolphins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 134" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28457" type="greek" key="me^las2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlas</orth>, <itype>ănos</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/las</foreign>, <sense id="n28457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a black spot on the skin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 18</bibl>; cf. melania.</sense></entryFree>
melaspermon: <entryFree id="n28458" type="greek" key="me^laspermon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlaspermon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/nspermon</foreign>, <sense id="n28458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> gith, <hi rend="ital">cultivated fennel-flower</hi> (v. melanthium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melculum: <entryFree id="n28459" type="main" key="melcu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">melcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">melcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mel; v. melliculus</etym>, a term of endearment, = melliculum, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 610</bibl> P. (where some read melliculum); applied to a male person, in the <case>voc.</case> melcule: vale mel gentium, melcule, ebur ex Etruria, laser Aretinum, etc., Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—Also, v. l. for melliculum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 16</bibl> and 23.</entryFree>
meldi: <entryFree id="n28460" type="main" key="Meldi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Meldi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Celtica, <hi rend="ital">between the Seine and Marne; their chief town</hi> answered to the modern <hi rend="ital">Meaux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mele: <entryFree id="n28461" type="main" key="me^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlē</orth>, Gr. <number>plur.</number> of melos, v. 1. melos.</entryFree>
meleager: <entryFree id="n28462" type="main" key="Me^le^a^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĕăger</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĕăgros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ag-rus</orth>), <itype>gri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mele/agros</foreign>, <sense id="n28462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of the Calydonian king Œneus and Althæa, one of the combatants at the Calydonian boar-hunt. His life depended on the preservation of an extinguished brand; this his mother burned, out of revenge for the death of her brothers who had fallen by his hand, and he expired</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:299 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 299 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:435" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 171 sq" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 171 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 306</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28462.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĕāgrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Meleager</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 365</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28462.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĕāgrĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28462.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The sisters of Meleager, who, according to the fable, bitterly lamented his death, and were changed into birds called after his name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 174" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:534 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 534 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n28462.4" n="2" level="3"> A kind of fowls, <hi rend="ital">Guinea-hens</hi>, the same as Gallinae Africanae, or a variety of them, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 26, 38, § 74</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28462.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĕāgrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melea/grios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Meleager, Meleagrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meleagris: <entryFree id="n28463" type="main" key="me^le^a_gris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĕāgris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Meleager, B. 2.</entryFree>
meles: <entryFree id="n28464" type="main" key="me_les1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēles</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maeles</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mae-lis</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 58, § 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 340</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28465" type="main" key="Me^les2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕles</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*me/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n28465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Ionia, near Smyrna, on the banks of which, it is said, Homer was born</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 60</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28465.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlētēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Meletean</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Homeric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:200" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28465.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-lētīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Meletine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deae,</quote> <trans><tr>dwelling at Meles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:236" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28466" type="main" key="Me^les3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n28466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur., a village in the Samnite territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melessi: <entryFree id="n28467" type="main" key="Melessi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melessi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melete: <entryFree id="n28468" type="main" key="Me^le^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĕtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mele/th</foreign>. <sense id="n28468.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28468.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: PORCIA MELETE, Inscr. Grut. <cb n="MELI" /> 357, 7.—</sense><sense id="n28468.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a plant, called also</hi> chamaeleon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meleteus: <entryFree id="n28469" type="main" key="Me^le_te_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlētēus</orth>, v. 2. Meles.</entryFree>
meletides: <entryFree id="n28470" type="hapax" key="Meleti_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Meletīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foolish Athenian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meliboea: <entryFree id="n28471" type="main" key="Me^li^boea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭboea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meli/boia</foreign>, <sense id="n28471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of Thessaly, at the foot of Mount Ossa, the birthplace of Philoctetes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 16, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28471.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n28471.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭboeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Melibœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 500</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 251</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28471.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭboeensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Melibœa</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meliboeus: <entryFree id="n28472" type="main" key="Me^li^boeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭboeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meli/boios</foreign>, <sense id="n28472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28473" type="main" key="Me^li^boeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭboeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Meliboea, II. A.</entryFree>
melica: <entryFree id="n28474" type="main" key="me_li^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, perh. <sense id="n28474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vessel</hi> (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 545, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl> and 23.</sense></entryFree>
meliceris: <entryFree id="n28475" type="greek" key="me^li^ce_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭcēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melikhri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tumor, meliceris</hi> (the yellow matter of which looks like honey): <cit><quote lang="la">melilotos contra meliceridas efficax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 87, § 151</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 30</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20</bibl>, called <foreign lang="greek">meli/khra</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
melicerta: <entryFree id="n28476" type="main" key="Me^li^certa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭcerta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭcertes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melike/rths</foreign>, <sense id="n28476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Ino and the Theban king Athamas. His mother, pursued by her husband in his madness, threw herself into the sea with Melicerta, who became a seagod, called by the Greeks</hi> Palaemon, <hi rend="ital">and by the Romans</hi> Portunus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 522</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:485 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 485 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:103" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melichloros: <entryFree id="n28477" type="greek" key="me^lichlo_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlichlōros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/xlwros</foreign>, <sense id="n28477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone yellow as honey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melichros: <entryFree id="n28478" type="greek" key="me^lichros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlichros</orth>, <itype>ōtos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/xrws</foreign>, <sense id="n28478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of honey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melichrysos: <entryFree id="n28479" type="greek" key="me^li^chry_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭchrȳsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/xrusos</foreign>, <sense id="n28479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gold-colored chrysolite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 45, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melicratum: <entryFree id="n28480" type="greek" key="me^licra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlicrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/kraton</foreign>, <sense id="n28480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water-mead</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 15, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melicus: <entryFree id="n28481" type="greek" key="me^li^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">meliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">musical, tuneful, melodious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 334</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28481.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">lyric, lyrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28481.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n28481.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lyric poet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Simonides melicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57, § 192</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28481.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lyric poem, ode</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28482" type="main" key="Me_li^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, in vulg. lang. for Medicus, <sense id="n28482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Median</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melie: <entryFree id="n28483" type="main" key="Me^li^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meli/a</foreign>. <sense id="n28483.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-nymph</hi>: Hestiaea, Melie, Ianthe, Hyg. Fab. praef.—</sense><sense id="n28483.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Bithynian nymph, beloved by the river-god Inachus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melilotos: <entryFree id="n28484" type="greek" key="me^li^lo_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭlōtos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/lwtos</foreign>, <sense id="n28484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of clover, melilot, also called</hi> sertula Campana: <cit><quote lang="la">pars meliloton amant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:440" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 440</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 37, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 7, 18, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melimela: <entryFree id="n28485" type="greek" key="me^li^me_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭmēla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/mhla</foreign>, <sense id="n28485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-apples</hi>, previously called <hi rend="ital">mustapples</hi> (mustea mala): <cit><quote lang="la">quae antea mustea vocabant, nunc melimela appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mustea a celeritate mitescendi, quae nunc melimela dicuntur a sapore melleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45" default="NO">12, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 25, 7</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>: melimelum a dulcedine appellatum, quod fructus ejus mellis saporem habeat, vel quod in melle servetur, unde et quidam (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 24, 1</bibl>) Si tibi Cecropio saturata Cydonia melle Ponentur: <cit><quote lang="la">dicas haec melimela licet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. melomeli.</sense></entryFree>
melimeli: <entryFree id="n28486" type="main" key="me_li^me^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭmĕli</orth>, v. melomeli.</entryFree>
melina: <entryFree id="n28487" type="main" key="me_li_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. melinus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28488" type="main" key="me^li^na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. melinus.</entryFree>
melinum: <entryFree id="n28489" type="main" key="me_li^num1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 3. melinus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28490" type="main" key="Me_li^num2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 4. Melinus.</entryFree>
melinus: <entryFree id="n28491" type="hapax" key="me_li_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. meles</etym>, <sense id="n28491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the marten;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (sc. crumena): <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a purse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wallet of marten-skin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28492" type="main" key="me^li^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to honey, honey-;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melinam promere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit> (al. mellinam); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 21</bibl> (al. mellina). <pb n="1128" /> <cb n="MELI" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28493" type="greek" key="me_li^nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/linos</foreign>, <sense id="n28493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to quinces, quince-; quinceyellow;</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28493.1" n="I" level="1"> (Sc. oleum.) <hi rend="ital">Quince-oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:103" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6, 54, § 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28493.2" n="II" level="1"> (Sc. unguentum.) <hi rend="ital">Quince-ointment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28493.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An eye-salve</hi>, Inscr. Tochōn, Cachets des Ocul. p. 61.—</sense><sense id="n28493.4" n="IV" level="1"> (Sc. vestimentum.) <hi rend="ital">A quince-yellow garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28494" type="main" key="Me_li^nus4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Melos</etym>, <sense id="n28494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the island of Melos, Melian; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of white color, Melian white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmentum, or simply Melinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 106</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 17, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melior: <entryFree id="n28495" type="main" key="me^li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭor</orth>, <itype>melĭus</itype> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ma=llon</foreign>, for <foreign lang="greek">ma/lion</foreign></etym>, v. bonus.</entryFree>
melioratio: <entryFree id="n28496" type="main" key="me^li^o_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>melioro</etym>, <sense id="n28496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bettering, improvement, melioration</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 66, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melioresco: <entryFree id="n28497" type="gloss" key="me^li^o_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭōresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n28497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to begin to improve, grow better;</hi> <foreign lang="greek">beltiou=mai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
melioro: <entryFree id="n28498" type="main" key="me^li^o_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭōro</orth> (no <sense id="n28498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>melior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make better, to better, improve</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">meliorare proprietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melioratum praedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 71, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melis: <entryFree id="n28499" type="main" key="me_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlis</orth>, v. 1. meles.</entryFree>
melisphyllum: <entryFree id="n28500" type="greek" key="me^lisphyllum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlisphyllum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlisso-phyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/fullon</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">melisso/fullon</foreign> (honey-leaf, bee-leaf), an herb of which bees are fond, <sense id="n28500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">balm-gentle, balm</hi> (also called apiastrum): <cit><quote lang="la">trita melis phylla, et cerinthae ignobile gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 45, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:149" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 86, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melissa: <entryFree id="n28501" type="main" key="Me^lissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/lissa</foreign>. <sense id="n28501.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nymph who is said to have invented the art of keeping bees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28501.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of the Cretan king Melissus, who, together with her sister Amalthea, fed Jupiter with goats' milk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 19</bibl> sq</sense></entryFree>
melisseus: <entryFree id="n28502" type="main" key="Me^lisseus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlisseus</orth>, v. Melissus, I.</entryFree>
melissophyllon: <entryFree id="n28503" type="main" key="me^lisso^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlissŏphyllon</orth>, v. melisphyllum.</entryFree>
melissus: <entryFree id="n28504" type="main" key="Me^lissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/lissos</foreign>. <sense id="n28504.0" n="I" level="1"> (Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlisseus</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melisseu/s</foreign>.) <hi rend="ital">A king of Crete, father of Melissa and Amalthea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 19</bibl>; ib. § 28.—</sense><sense id="n28504.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grammarian and comic poet, librarian to Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28504.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher of Samos</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
