melita: <entryFree id="n28505" type="main" key="Me^li^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meli/th</foreign>. <sense id="n28505.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The isle of Malta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28505.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island off the coast of Dalmatia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Meleda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:567" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 567</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28505.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28505.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Cappadocia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28505.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seanymph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 825</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melitaeus: <entryFree id="n28506" type="main" key="Me^li^taeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*melitai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n28506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Dalmatian island</hi> Melita, <hi rend="ital">Melitæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 14, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melitanus: <entryFree id="n28507" type="main" key="Me^li^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Melita, Melitan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 751, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melite: <entryFree id="n28508" type="main" key="Me^li^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Melita.</entryFree>
melitensis: <entryFree id="n28509" type="main" key="Me^li^tensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Melita</etym>, <sense id="n28509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the isle of Malta, Melitan, Maltese</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>, § 27.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-lĭtensia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (sc. vestimenta), <hi rend="ital">Melitan garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1130</bibl>, the correct read. is alidensia).</sense></entryFree>
melitesius: <entryFree id="n28510" type="main" key="Me^li^te_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Melitan, Maltese</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melitesia Coralia (al. Melitensia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 404</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melitinus: <entryFree id="n28511" type="greek" key="me^li^ti^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/tinos</foreign>, <sense id="n28511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to honey, mixed with honey</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28511.1" n="2" level="3"> Lapis, <hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 33, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28512" type="main" key="Me^li^ti_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlĭtīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n28512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, Inscr. Visc. Opt. Varr. t. 1, p. 182; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 45</bibl>, n. 255.</sense></entryFree>
melitis: <entryFree id="n28513" type="spur" key="me_li_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† mēlītis</orth>, a false read. for chalcitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</entryFree>
melitites: <entryFree id="n28514" type="greek" key="me^li^ti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭtītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meliti/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n28514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a honey-drink made of honey and must</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 85</bibl> (but a false read. for melitinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 33, § 140</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
meliton: <entryFree id="n28515" type="hapax" key="meli^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">melĭton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melittaena: <entryFree id="n28516" type="greek" key="me^littaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlittaena</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mĕlitaena</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <cb n="MELL" /> = <foreign lang="greek">meli/ttaina</foreign>. <sense id="n28516.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, also called</hi> marrubium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28516.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, also called</hi> melissophyllon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 86, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melitturgus: <entryFree id="n28517" type="greek" key="me^litturgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlitturgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melittourgo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bee-keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melium: <entryFree id="n28518" type="main" key="me_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dog's collar</hi>, v. mellum.</sense></entryFree>
melius: <entryFree id="n28519" type="main" key="me^li^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭus</orth>, <sense id="n28519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp. adj.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos>, v. bonus.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28520" type="main" key="Me_li^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. Melos</etym>, <sense id="n28520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the isle of Melos, Melian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diagoras Melius,</quote> <trans><tr>dwelling in Melos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meliuscule: <entryFree id="n28521" type="main" key="me^li^uscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭuscŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. meliusculus <sense id="n28521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
meliusculus: <entryFree id="n28522" type="main" key="me^li^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [melius], <hi rend="ital">somewhat better, rather better</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.).—Of a convalescent: <cit><quote lang="la">qui meliusculus esse coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 19</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">si eris verax, ex tuis rebus feceris meliusculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">v. 6: apes coloris meliusculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: spes, <hi rend="ital">rather more</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 394, 10</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliusculum est monere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭuscŭlē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n28522.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rather better, pretty well</hi> (class.): cum meliuscule tibi esset, <hi rend="ital">when you were somewhat better</hi> (of a convalescent), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 12</bibl></cit> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n28522.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rather more, somewhat more</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliuscule quam satis fuerit, biberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melizomum: <entryFree id="n28523" type="greek" key="me^lizo_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlizōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meli/zwmon</foreign>, <sense id="n28523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-sauce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mella: <entryFree id="n28524" type="main" key="mella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mel</etym>, perh. for mellea (sc. aqua), <sense id="n28524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-water</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:3" default="NO">12, 49, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28525" type="main" key="Mella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mella</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Upper Italy, near Brescia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curva legunt prope flumina Mellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 278</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28526" type="hapax" key="Mella3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Annaea, e. g. M. Annaeus Mella, <hi rend="ital">the father of Lucan.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mellaceum: <entryFree id="n28527" type="main" key="mella_ce^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellācĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">must</hi> (postclass. for sapa): <cit><quote lang="la">sapa, quod nunc mellaceum dicimus, mustum ad mediam partem decoctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mellaria: <entryFree id="n28528" type="main" key="Mella_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellāria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellā-rĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mellaria;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellārĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mellaria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 321, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mellarius: <entryFree id="n28529" type="main" key="mella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to honey, honey-</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa mellaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 82</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28529.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bee-keeper, beemaster</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28529.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mellārium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a beehive, apiary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mellatio: <entryFree id="n28530" type="main" key="mella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mello</etym>, <sense id="n28530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a honeying, honey-gathering, taking of honey from the hive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melleus: <entryFree id="n28531" type="main" key="melle^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to honey, honey-</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28531.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sardonyches,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 19, 33, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crustum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Eph. Parecb. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28531.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">honeysweet, delightful, charming</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">moduli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
melliculus: <entryFree id="n28532" type="main" key="melli^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">honey-sweet, honeyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpusculum melliculum! a coaxing epithet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">honey-pet, honey-kin.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 14</bibl>.—Collat. form melculum, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
mellifer: <entryFree id="n28533" type="main" key="melli^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel-fero</etym>, <sense id="n28533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-bearing, honey-producing, melliferous</hi> (pcet.): <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mellifex: <entryFree id="n28534" type="spur" key="melli^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mel-facio</etym>, i. q. mellarius, 1., <sense id="n28534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a honey-maker</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a keeper of bees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicunque saltus idonei sunt mellifici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; better referred to mellificus, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
mellificium: <entryFree id="n28535" type="main" key="melli^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the making of honey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mellificium aptissimum est thymum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mellifico: <entryFree id="n28536" type="main" key="melli^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mellificus</etym>, <sense id="n28536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make honey</hi> (poet and in post-Aug. prose): sic <cb n="MELO" /> vos non vobis mellificatis apes, Verg. ap Don. Vit. Verg. (but ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 59</bibl>, mella faciunt; v. Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
mellificus: <entryFree id="n28537" type="main" key="melli^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel-facio</etym>, <sense id="n28537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-making, fit for making honey</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; v. mellifex.</sense></entryFree>
mellifluens: <entryFree id="n28538" type="hapax" key="melliflu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">melliflŭens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n28538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-dropping;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">mellifluous</hi>, of a speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">Nestor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epist. 16, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mellifluus: <entryFree id="n28539" type="main" key="melliflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">melliflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing with honey, honey-dropping</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n28539.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 468</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28539.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mellifluous</hi>: Homerus melliflui oris, Boëth. Metr. 5, 2, 2.</sense></entryFree>
melligenus: <entryFree id="n28540" type="spur" key="melli^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a false read. for melliginis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 7, 10, § 28</bibl>.</entryFree>
melliger: <entryFree id="n28541" type="main" key="melli^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel-gero</etym>, <sense id="n28541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honey-bearing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Laud. Virgin. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melligerus: <entryFree id="n28542" type="main" key="Melli^ge^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellĭgĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 1329, 1.</sense></entryFree>
melligo: <entryFree id="n28543" type="main" key="melli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mel</etym>. <sense id="n28543.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A honey-like juice</hi>, sucked by the bees from flowers, but not yet made into honey, <hi rend="ital">bee-glue, bees'rosin, hive-dross</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 6, 5, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 7, 10, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28543.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The juice of unripe grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 27, 60, § 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mellilla: <entryFree id="n28544" type="hapax" key="mellilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. melinus</etym>, a term of endearment, <sense id="n28544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little honey, little sweetheart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea vita, mea mellilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
mellina: <entryFree id="n28545" type="main" key="melli^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. melinus.</entryFree>
mellinia: <entryFree id="n28546" type="hapax" key="melli^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness, deliciousness, delight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nimio magnae melliniae mihist,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Spengel (al. mellinae).</sense></entryFree>
mellitulus: <entryFree id="n28547" type="main" key="melli_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellītŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mellitus], <hi rend="ital">honey-sweet, darling</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpusculum mellitulum! (al. melliculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 79, 6</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mellītŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">little honey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea mellitula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, 139, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mellitus: <entryFree id="n28548" type="main" key="melli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of honey, honey-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28548.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">melliti favi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: bellaria, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absorptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28548.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sweetened with honey, honey-sweet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28548.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">honey-sweet, darling, lovely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: Cicero, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum globuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>.—So in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: ubi ubi es mellitissime, Marc. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep ad Caes. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep ad Caes. 4, 5</bibl> Mai.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mellitissimum savium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 10, p. 119</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mellītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi mellite, mi marite,</quote> <trans><tr>my honey, my darling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 6</bibl></cit>, p 161.</sense></entryFree>
mello: <entryFree id="n28549" type="main" key="mello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mello</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collect honey</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
mellona: <entryFree id="n28550" type="main" key="Mello_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of bees and honey</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 24.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellōnĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melloproximus: <entryFree id="n28551" type="main" key="Mello^proxi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mellŏproxĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, vox hibr. [<foreign lang="greek">me/llw-</foreign>proximus], <sense id="n28551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who comes next in rank to the Proximus;</hi> v. h. v. under propior, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mellosus: <entryFree id="n28552" type="main" key="mello_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mel</etym>, <sense id="n28552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from honey, honey-, honey-like</hi> (post-class. for melleus): <cit><quote lang="la">mellosa dulcedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:151" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mellum: <entryFree id="n28553" type="main" key="mellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dog's collar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 15</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. melium and maelium).—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">millus</orth>, i: millus collare canum venaticorum, factum ex corio confixumque clavis ferreis eminentibus adversus impetum luporum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=151" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 151</bibl> Müll.—Also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">melium, mil-lus</orth>, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
melo: <entryFree id="n28554" type="main" key="Me_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, old Latin name for the Nile: Melo nomine alio Nilus vocatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 7</bibl> and p. 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 4, 291</bibl>: <sense id="n28554.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Melonis alba filia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the paper-reed growing in the Nile</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epist. 4, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28555" type="greek" key="me_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh=lon</foreign>, <sense id="n28555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apple-shaped melon</hi>, for melopepo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melocarpon: <entryFree id="n28556" type="main" key="me_lo_carpon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōcarpon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> aristolochia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melodes: <entryFree id="n28557" type="greek" key="me^lo_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melw/|dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n28557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pleasing, charming singer</hi> (post-class.): Proculus melodes insonare pulsibus (al. melodis) <pb n="1129" /> <cb n="MEMB" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 15</bibl>.—Also in <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlōdes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1157, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melodia: <entryFree id="n28558" type="greek" key="me^lo_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlōdĭa</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melw|di/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pleasant song, melody</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 905</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melodiae compositor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melodicus: <entryFree id="n28559" type="greek" key="me^lo_di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlōdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">melwdiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melodious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
melodina: <entryFree id="n28560" type="main" key="me^lo_di^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlōdĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>melodia</etym>, <sense id="n28560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a melody</hi> (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 33</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
melodunum: <entryFree id="n28561" type="hapax" key="Melodu_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melodūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Senones</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Melun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 60, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melodus: <entryFree id="n28562" type="greek" key="me^lo_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlōdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">melw|do/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasantly singing, melodious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlōda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a melody</hi>: lyricae melodae, Ven. Carm. 9, 7, 13.</sense></entryFree>
melofolia: <entryFree id="n28563" type="greek" key="me_lo^fo^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlŏfŏlĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, vox hibr. [<foreign lang="greek">mh=lon-</foreign>folium], <sense id="n28563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apples with a leaf on the side</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melomeli: <entryFree id="n28564" type="greek" key="me_lo^me^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlŏmĕli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mēlĭmĕli</orth>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhlo/meli</foreign>, <sense id="n28564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sirup of preserved quinces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melopepo: <entryFree id="n28565" type="greek" key="me_lo^pe^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlŏpĕpo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhlope/pwn</foreign>, <sense id="n28565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apple-shaped melon, cucumber-melon</hi>, not eaten till fully ripe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melophyllon: <entryFree id="n28566" type="main" key="me_lophyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlophyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> millefolium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melopoeia: <entryFree id="n28567" type="greek" key="me^lo^poei^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlŏpoeĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">melopoli\a</foreign>, <sense id="n28567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">musical composition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melopoeia est habitus modulationis effectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 965 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
melos: <entryFree id="n28568" type="greek" key="me^los1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (Greek <number>plur.</number> mele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 412</bibl>.—In <sense id="n28568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: quosdam melos, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 17</bibl>; so Pac. and Varr. ib.), = <foreign lang="greek">me/los</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a tune, air, strain, song, lay</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): suave summum melos, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 11</bibl>: quosdam melos, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 77, 7</bibl>: Silvani melo Consimilis cantus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: Pegaseium, Pers. prol. —Greek <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui brevia mela modifica recino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28569" type="main" key="Me_los2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mh=los</foreign>, <sense id="n28569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea, one of the Cyclades</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Milo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28569.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Melos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diagoras Melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28569.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 4. Melinus.</sense></entryFree>
melosmos: <entryFree id="n28570" type="main" key="melosmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">melosmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> polion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melota: <entryFree id="n28571" type="greek" key="me_lo_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōtē</orth>, <itype>ōs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhlwth/</foreign>, <sense id="n28571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sheepskin</hi> (with the wool on): <cit><quote lang="la">circumierunt in melotis, in pellibus caprinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:76" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 76</bibl>. —Collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōtes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 24, 19</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōtis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 15, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melothron: <entryFree id="n28572" type="greek" key="me_lo_thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōthron</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōtrum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/lwqron</foreign>, <sense id="n28572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, the white bryony</hi>, called, in pure Lat., vitis alba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melotis: <entryFree id="n28573" type="main" key="Melo_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melotris: <entryFree id="n28574" type="main" key="me_lo_tris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēlōtris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhlwtri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a probe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, mostly for the ears, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:63" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
melpomene: <entryFree id="n28575" type="main" key="Melpo^me^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Melpŏmĕnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*melpome/nh</foreign> (the songstress), <sense id="n28575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the muse of tragic and lyric poetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melpomene, cui liquidam pater Vocem cum citharā dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:37:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meltom: <entryFree id="n28576" type="gloss" key="meltom"><orth extent="full" lang="la">meltom</orth>, v. bonus <sense id="n28576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
memaceni: <entryFree id="n28577" type="main" key="Memace_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memacēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia, beyond the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
membrana: <entryFree id="n28578" type="main" key="membra_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>membrum</etym>, <sense id="n28578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">membrane</hi> that covers parts of the body (class.). </sense><sense id="n28578.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura oculos membranis tenuissimis vestivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebri,</quote> <trans><tr>the membrane of the brain, meninges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranis cicadae volant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 33, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranis volant fragilibus insecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28578.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slough</hi> of snakes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 679</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28578.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28578.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The thin skin</hi> of plants and other things, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corio et membrana Punica (teguntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimis membranis velatur allium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putaminis ovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28578.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A skin</hi> prepared for writing, etc., <hi rend="ital">parchment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri carmen in Membrana scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 21, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>: sic raro scribis, ut toto non quater anno Membranam<cb n="MEMB" />  poscas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasiae, for drawing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croceae membrana tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in chartulis sive membranis meis aliquis scripserit, meum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:77" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28578.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The surface, outside</hi> of a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 95</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scies, sub ista tenui membrana dignitatis quantum mali jaceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
membranaceus: <entryFree id="n28579" type="main" key="membra_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrānācĕus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>membrana</etym>, <sense id="n28579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">membrane, skinny, membranaceous</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vespertilio, cui membranaceae pinnae uni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 61, 81, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PVGILLARES,</quote> <trans><tr>of parchment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 174, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28579.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Like a skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">membrane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam cortex membranaceus, ut viti, arundini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 55, § 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
membranarius: <entryFree id="n28580" type="main" key="membra_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrānārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parchment-maker</hi> (post-class.), Edict. Dioclet. p. 20; cf. membranarius, <foreign lang="greek">difqeropoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
membraneus: <entryFree id="n28581" type="main" key="membra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of parchment</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pugillares membranei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">codices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:50:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 50, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
membranula: <entryFree id="n28582" type="main" key="membra_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrānŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">membrane.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28582.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranula, quae sub cute calvariam cingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>membrane of the eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28582.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28582.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A parchment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisque imperes, ut sumant membranulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit>, b, 1.—</sense><sense id="n28582.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur., an instrument</hi> or <hi rend="ital">document written on parchment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae membranulis meā manu scriptis continebuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 102</bibl></cit> prooem.</sense></entryFree>
membranulum: <entryFree id="n28583" type="hapax" key="membra_nu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrānŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, for membranula, <sense id="n28583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">membrane</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
membratim: <entryFree id="n28584" type="main" key="membra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>membrum</etym>, <sense id="n28584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by limbs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">members, in the limbs, limb by limb, from member to member.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28584.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membratim vitalem deperdere sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc peractis malis, quae membratim sentiuntur, dicemus de his, quae totis corporibus grassantur,</quote> <trans><tr>in single limbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 67, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedere,</quote> <trans><tr>in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28584.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">piecemeal, singly, severally</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28584.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">membratim enumerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium naturae generatim membratimque ita se habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">1: gestum negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 35, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28584.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">in little clauses, in short sentences</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">67, 223</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">membratim caesimque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
membratura: <entryFree id="n28585" type="hapax" key="membra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>membro</etym>, <sense id="n28585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the formation of the limbs, constitution of the body</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
membripotens: <entryFree id="n28586" type="main" key="membri^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>membrum-potens</etym>, <sense id="n28586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruling in the members</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 2, 11.</sense></entryFree>
membro: <entryFree id="n28587" type="main" key="membro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>membrum</etym>, <sense id="n28587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form limb by limb, to furnish with limbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque et triginta diebus infans membratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Hex. 220</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
membrosus: <entryFree id="n28588" type="hapax" key="membro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">large membered</hi>: hortorum custos membrosior aequo, i. e. majori mentula praeditus, Auct. Priap. prooem.</sense></entryFree>
membrum: <entryFree id="n28589" type="main" key="membrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">membrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. for mems-trum; cf. Sanscr. māmsa, flesh</etym>, <sense id="n28589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a limb, member</hi> of the body (class.). </sense><sense id="n28589.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam membrorum, id est partium corporis, alia videntur propter eorum usum a natura esse donata, ut manus, crura, pedes, etc. . . . alia quasi ad quendam ornatum, ut cauda pavoni, plumae versicolores columbis, viris mammae atque barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hispida membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrum lacerum laesumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter membrum ruptum talio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:223" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28589.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 70, 17</bibl>. So <number>plur.</number> membra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 65</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 6, p. 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 31</bibl>, p. 254; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 120, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28589.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28589.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n28589.5" n="1" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">a part, portion, division</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes philosophiae partes atque omnia membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere quassatae parcite membra ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnia philosophiae membra prudenter disputando currere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: eadem sunt membra in <cb n="MEMI" /> utrāque disputatione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n28589.6" n="2" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponticus . . . Bassus . . . dulcia convictūs membra fuere mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra et partes alienae potentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuantia membra Libyae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:310" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 310</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28589.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n28589.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A member of the state</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per multa membra civitas in unum tantum corpus redigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra partesque imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae totius membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaei scilicet per civitates velut per membra divisi sunt, unum tamen corpus et unum imperium habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: corpore sic toto ac membris Roma usa. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:318" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 318</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ut decisa atque avulsa a corpore membra despiciar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:670" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 670</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28589.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An apartment, chamber</hi> in a house: <cit><quote lang="la">dormitorium membrum,</quote> <trans><tr>a bed-chamber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, 28, p. 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>, p. 188: <cit><quote lang="la">modus membrorum numerusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubicula et ejusmodi membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28589.10" n="3" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">a member</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clause</hi> of a sentence: quae Graeci <foreign lang="greek">ko/mmata</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">kw=la</foreign> nominant, nos recte incisa et membra dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:211" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 62, 211</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28589.11" n="4" level="3"> Of the Church of Christ: <cit><quote lang="la">singuli autem alter alterius membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: membra sumus corporis ejus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Christ's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 5, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
memecylon: <entryFree id="n28590" type="greek" key="me_me^cy^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēmĕcylon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhme/kulon, mimai/kulon</foreign>, <sense id="n28590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the edible fruit of the strawberrytree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
memet: <entryFree id="n28591" type="main" key="me_met"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēmet</orth>, <case>acc.</case> of ego with met, v. ego and met.</entryFree>
meminens: <entryFree id="n28592" type="main" key="me^mi^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmĭnens</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. memini <sense id="n28592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
memini: <entryFree id="n28593" type="main" key="me^mi^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmĭni</orth>, <itype>isse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. man, think; upaman = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pome/nein</foreign>, await; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">men-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">me/nw, *me/ntwr; man-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">mai/nomai, ma/ntis; mna=-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">mimnh/skw</foreign>, etc.; cf.: maneo, moneo, reminiscor, mens, Minerva, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n28593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remember, recollect, to think of, be mindful of</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">not to have forgotten</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to bear in mind</hi> (syn.: reminiscor, recordor); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> of the person and of the thing, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">cum;</hi> with the <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (usually the <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>, sometimes the <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.;</hi> class.). </sense><sense id="n28593.1" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivorum memini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 75, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti paterni,</quote> <trans><tr>to be mindful of, not forget to revenge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:773" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 773</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque homo rem meminit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta facito ut memineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia meminit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cinnam memini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 45</bibl></cit>.—With ellips. of <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque adeo edepol flocci facio, quando egomet memini mihi (sc. nomen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.3" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pallā memento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Herode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.4" n="4" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministi, quanta hominum esset admiratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.5" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministin', olim ut fuerit vestra oratio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.6" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini, cum mihi desipere videbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28593.7" n="7" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28593.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi> (so usually of the direct memory of an eyewitness): memini me fiere pavum, Enn. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 15 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">memini Catonem mecum disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini Pamphylum mihi narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini te mihi Phameae cenam narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministis fieri senatusconsultum referente me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 25, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mementote hos esse pertimescendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memento mihi suppetias ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> memento with <hi rend="ital">inf., remember to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be sure to, do not fail to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memento ergo dimidium mihi istinc de praeda dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei et hoc memento (sc. dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram cohibere memento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> (so usu. when the subject is not an eye-witness; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. with second and third persons of memini): peto, ut memineris. te omnia mihi cumulate recepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 72, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministis me ita distribuisse initio causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:42:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 42, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memineram ... divinum virum ... senile corpus paludibus occultasse demersum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini gloriari solitum esse Q. Hortensium, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: memento me, <pb n="1130" /> <cb n="MEMO" /> son de meā, sed de oratoris facultate dixisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 78</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">meminit lēvor praestare salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 153</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.10" n="8" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, memini et scio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte meministi,</quote> <trans><tr>your recollection is accurate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28593.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make mention of, to mention</hi> a thing, either in speaking or writing (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meministi ipse de exsulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque omnino hujus rei meminit us quam poëta ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: Achillam, cujus supra meminimus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu, qui hujus judicii meministi, cur oblitus es illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl>: meminerunt hujus conjurationis Janusius Geminus in historia. M. Bibulus in edictis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>.—Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., mindful</hi> (ante- and post-class.): meminens corde volutat, Liv Andr ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 922</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi, quod periit. meminens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meminens naturae et professionis oblitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
memmius: <entryFree id="n28594" type="main" key="Memmius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memmius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n28594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. mox Italus Mnestheus, genus, a quo nomine Memmi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 117</bibl>. So C. Memmius, <hi rend="ital">a public man, who, being adjudged guilty of</hi> ambitus, <hi rend="ital">went into exile to Athens</hi>, to him Cicero addressed several letters, and to him Lucretius dedicated his poem, De Rerum Natura; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 42</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28594.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memmĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Memmian</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">a Memmiade, a Memmius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28594.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memmĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Memmius</hi>: praedia, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> C. Memmius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
memnon: <entryFree id="n28595" type="main" key="Memnon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*memnwn</foreign>, <sense id="n28595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Tithonus and Aurora, and king of the Ethiopians; he went to the aid of the Trojans, and was slain by Achilles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigri Memnonis arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 489</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">When burned on the funeral pile he is said to have been changed by Aurora into a bird, while from his ashes many other birds flew up, called</hi> Memnoniae or Memnonides, <hi rend="ital">who every year flew from Ethiopia to Troy and fought over Memnon's tomb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:600 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 600 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:617" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 617</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 26, 37, § 74</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">The black marble statue of Memnon, near Thebes, when struck by the first beams of the sun, gave forth a sound like that of a lute-string, which was regarded as Memnon's greeting to his mother</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidio magicae resonant ubi Memnone chordae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mater lutea Memnonis, i. e. Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:714" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnonis saxea effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—The fate of Memnon was the subject of a poem by Alpinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 10, 36</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n28595.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Memnon, Memnonian</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28595.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnoniae aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28595.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Oriental, Moorish, black</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 284</bibl></cit>.— Esp., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnŏnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Menn-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone, of a black color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28595.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnŏnĭ-des</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">plur., the birds of Memnon;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>.</sense></entryFree>
memnonia: <entryFree id="n28596" type="main" key="Memno^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Memnon.</entryFree>
memnonides: <entryFree id="n28597" type="main" key="Memno^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Memnon.</entryFree>
memnonius: <entryFree id="n28598" type="main" key="Memno^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memnŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Memnon.</entryFree>
memor: <entryFree id="n28599" type="main" key="me^mor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (anciently memoris, memore, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 772</bibl> P.; <sense id="n28599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> memorior, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 699</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root smar-, in smarti, memory; smara, love; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/rtus</foreign>, witness; <foreign lang="greek">me/rimna</foreign>, care; cf.: memoria, mora, etc., not from memini</etym>, <hi rend="ital">mindful of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">remembering;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">rel,clause</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28599.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n28599.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut memor esses sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se eorum facti memorem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinarum virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique sui memores alios fecere merendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 14</bibl></cit>;
