<bibl default="NO">1, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vale nostri memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:318" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 318</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28599.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memor Lucullum periisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 7, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memor objectum ab eo sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28599.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel. -clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memor, quo ordine quisque discubuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vive memor, quam sis aevi brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28599.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorem et gratum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 25</bibl></cit>: et bene apud memores veteris stat gratia facti, <hi rend="ital">grateful</hi>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 539</bibl>: cf. 6, <cb n="MEMO" /> 664 supra: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa memor praecepta canam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 28</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacem memorem esse oportet,</quote> <trans><tr>a liar should have a good memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28599.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of inanim. things et cadum Marsi memorem duelli, <hi rend="ital">which remembers the Marsian war</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">was made during that war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium erat in Anco ingenium, et Numae et Romuli memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:20:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> P 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:4:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevae Junonis ira,</quote> <trans><tr>vindictive, avenging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium exempli parum memoris legum humanarum,</quote> <trans><tr>unmindful of, not observing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28599.7" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n28599.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That easily remembers, possessed of a good memory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ingeniosus ac memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28599.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">that reminds</hi> one of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri memorem sepulcro Scalpe querelam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impressit memorem dente labris notam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicii memor poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:744" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n28599.10" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏre</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by heart, readily</hi> (ante-class.): cum ista memore meministi, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 23</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 109 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n28599.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n28599.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">From memory, by personal recollection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio est habita memoriter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ordines memoriter salutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Mucius multa narrare de Laelio memoriter et jucunde solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28599.13" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n28599.14" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">With a good memory, by ready recollection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista exposuisti, ut tam multa, memoriter, ut tam obscura, dilucide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut memoriter me Sauream vocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic quidem quae illic sunt res gestae memorat memoriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem istuc si potes memoriter meminisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, p. 89</bibl> P. (Com. Fragm. v. 365 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n28599.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fully, accurately, correctly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriter respondeto ad ea quae rogāro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra Aratea memoriter a te pronuntiata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 17, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, qui tam memoriter tenes omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 11</bibl></cit> (cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28600" type="main" key="Me^mor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕmor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, lnscr. Mur. 1128, 5.</sense></entryFree>
memorabilis: <entryFree id="n28601" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>memoro</etym>, <sense id="n28601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">memorable, remarkable, worthy of being remembered; heard of, conceivable; worthy to be mentioned, fit to be spoken of</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoccine credibile est. aut memorabile?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bellum est, nec memorabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc memorabilest, ego tu sum, tu es ego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Stich 5, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua pugna illud memorabile fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni gutturis exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏ-rābĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a noteworthy fact, strange occurrence</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">multa memorabilia et in domesticis et in bellicis rebus effecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus de mundo ... nunc reliqua caeli memorabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 102</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., memorably, remarkably</hi>, Aug. c. Jul. 2, 7, 11.</sense></entryFree>
memoraculum: <entryFree id="n28602" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monument</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 311, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
memoralis: <entryFree id="n28603" type="spur" key="me^mo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, false read. for memorialis, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 196</bibl>.</entryFree>
memoraliter: <entryFree id="n28604" type="hapax" key="me^mo^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>memoria</etym>, <sense id="n28604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to make mention</hi>, Ven. Fort. Carm. 4, 20.</sense></entryFree>
memoralius: <entryFree id="n28605" type="gloss" key="me^mo^ra_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrālĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>memoro</etym>, <sense id="n28605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recorder, notary</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">u(pomnhmatogra/fos</foreign>, actuarius, memoralius, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
memorandus: <entryFree id="n28606" type="main" key="me^mo^randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. memo ro <sense id="n28606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
memoratio: <entryFree id="n28607" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>memoro</etym>, <sense id="n28607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mentioning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0524,001:1:291" default="NO"><author>Corn. Gall.</author> 1, 291</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
memorator: <entryFree id="n28608" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who mentions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recounts, a relater</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tui casūs memorator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 33.</sense></entryFree>
memoratrix: <entryFree id="n28609" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>memorator</etym>, <sense id="n28609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who mentions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relates</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:142" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
memoratus: <entryFree id="n28610" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. memoro <sense id="n28610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28611" type="main" key="me^mo^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>memoro</etym>, <sense id="n28611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="MEMO" /> <hi rend="ital">mentioning, relating; a mention, relation</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">istaec lepida sunt memoratui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne hoc miserum memoratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva et levia memoratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 73</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">flumen memoratu dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
memore: <entryFree id="n28612" type="main" key="me^mo^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. memor <sense id="n28612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
memoria: <entryFree id="n28613" type="main" key="me^mo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>memor</etym>. <sense id="n28613.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The faculty of remembering, memory, recollection</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi me fugiet memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Edepol, memoria's optumad,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnis ac lenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensius memoriā tantā fuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in memoria mea penitus insedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam redigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to recall to mind, recollect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam reducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit> memoriā comprehendere, <hi rend="ital">to hold in the memory, commit to memory</hi>, id. do Or. 1, 34, 154: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā custodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam agitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to exercise the memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere in memoriā,</quote> <trans><tr>to remember</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est mihi in memoriā,</quote> <trans><tr>in my recollection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere aliquid ex memoriā,</quote> <trans><tr>to forget a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam alicujus deponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to forget</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si memoria fefellerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fugit memoriam meam,</quote> <trans><tr>has escaped my recollection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem excidisse de memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 33, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit> ut mea memoria est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex memoriā exponam,</quote> <trans><tr>from memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28613.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Memory, remembrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid faciendumst mulieri male ... Ibi ei inmortalis memoriast meminisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: verterunt sese memoriae, <hi rend="ital">remembrances are altered</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">times are changed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā dign' viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae prodere sermonem alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to hand down to posterity, to leave in writing, to record</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam prodere,</quote> <trans><tr>to transmit, hand down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditur memoriae, prolapsum cecidisse,</quote> <trans><tr>it is related</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivit, vivetque per omnium saeculorum memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) ad memoriam laudum domesticarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum memoria et recordatio jucunda sane fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria immortalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28613.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28613.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The time of remembrance, period of recollection, time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi superiori memoriā se in alias civitates contulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>in earlier times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cratippus princeps hujus memoriae philosophorum,</quote> <trans><tr>in our time, at the present time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod persaepe et nostrā, et patrum memoriā acci dit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad nostram memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in omni memoriā est omnino inauditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post hominum memoriam,</quote> <trans><tr>since the memory of man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo supra hanc memoriam,</quote> <trans><tr>a little before this, a short time since</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28613.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An historical account, relation, narration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber, quo iste omnium rerum memoriam breviter complexus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Magonis interitu duplex memoria prodita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam vitae prosā oratione composuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n28613.5" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a written account, narrative, memoir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quispiam ex his, qui se ad litteras memoriasque veteres dediderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veteribus memoriis scriptum legimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:8:1" default="NO">7, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā pristini auctoris memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28613.6" n="c" level="4"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">A monument</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a Christian church as a memorial of a saint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">monument of a martyr</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriā Cypriani manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf 5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: memoriae martyrum templis deorum succedunt, id. Civ. Dei, 26, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">22, 8, 11 and 12 al.: memoriam sibi et suis com parare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 827, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28613.7" n="III" level="1"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of memory</hi>, = Mnemosyne, Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis (filias, ex memoria uxore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, c. 37.</sense></entryFree>
memorialis: <entryFree id="n28614" type="main" key="me^mo^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>memoria</etym>, <sense id="n28614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to memory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remembrance, memorial</hi> (post-Aug.): libellus. <hi rend="ital">a memoran dum-book</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28614.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28614.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕmŏrĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a historiographer</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 29, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28614.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <pb n="1131" /> <cb n="MEMP" /> <hi rend="ital">memorial, that which keeps in remembrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domine, tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:135:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 135, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28614.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭālia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">plur., memoirs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3</bibl>. 6, 11.— <cit><quote lang="la">The title of a book by Sabinus Masurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 7, 8. Sabinus in septimo memoriall, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl></sense></entryFree>
memoriola: <entryFree id="n28615" type="main" key="me^mo^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>memoria</etym>. * <sense id="n28615.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Memory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriolā vacillare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28615.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A monument, tomb</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 85, 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 994, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
memoriose: <entryFree id="n28616" type="gloss" key="me^mo^ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. memoriosus.</entryFree>
memoriosus: <entryFree id="n28617" type="gloss" key="me^mo^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>memoria</etym>, <sense id="n28617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a good memory</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.: memoriosus, et memoriose, Fronto de Differ. Voc. p. 2194 P.; cf.: memoriosus, <foreign lang="greek">mnhmoniko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with a good memory</hi>, Fronto l. l.</sense></entryFree>
memoritei: <entryFree id="n28618" type="main" key="me^mo^ri^tei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrĭtei</orth> <pos>adv.</pos>, v. memor <sense id="n28618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
memoro: <entryFree id="n28619" type="main" key="me^mo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (archaic <sense id="n28619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> memorarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 99</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>memor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to remembrance, remind of, to mention, recount, relate, speak about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of, say, tell</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28619.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorare mores mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen memora tuom mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos absentis testis memoras,</quote> <trans><tr>callest on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam arma inciperent, misere legatos amicitiam obsequiumque memoraturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam rhombi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 129</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illa pote pejus muliere memorarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ea, quae dico, gesta esse memorantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus conditor Hercules memorabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>was said to have been, was remembered as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorari exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28619.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de naturā nimis obscure memoravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28619.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem infestum ac odiosum sibi esse, memorabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculem in eo loco boves abegisse memorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates, quem imperitasse Armeniis memoravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palamedem memorant sedecim litterarum formas repperisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28619.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musa, velim memores, quo patre natus uterque Contulerit lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 53</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic memorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 631</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28619.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to speak, utter, make use of</hi> in speech: <cit><quote lang="la">scio ego multos memoravisse milites mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula memorata Catonibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28619.6" n="II" level="1"> Memorare significat nunc dicere, nunc memoriae mandare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28619.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., memorable, renowned, celebrated</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc nobis deus ille magister nequiquam memoratus Eryx?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus Italiae ... fama multis memoratus in oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 564</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 170, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 172, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum memoratissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28619.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">before mentioned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n28619.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., worthy of remembrance, memorable, celebrated</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis memorande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 793</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae memorandae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:33" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
memoror: <entryFree id="n28620" type="main" key="me^mo^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕmŏror</orth>, <itype>ātus sum</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remember, be mindful of</hi> (eccl. Lat.).— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 31, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Laps. Virg. 5, 19</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:7:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 7, 40 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
memphis: <entryFree id="n28621" type="main" key="Memphis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Memphis</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*memfis</foreign>, <sense id="n28621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Middle Egypt, celebrated as the residence of the Egyptian kings</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Metrahenny</hi> (fourteen miles south of Cairo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9, 9, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae colis, et Memphin, palmiferamque Pharon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n28621.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memphītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., Memphite, of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the city of Memphis, Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memphiten plangere bovem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit> (7), 28 lapis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28621.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memphītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Memphitic, Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28621.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Memphītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., Memphite, Egyptian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">terrā Memphitide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Io</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 136</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MEND" /></sense></entryFree>
mena: <entryFree id="n28622" type="main" key="me_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. maena.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28623" type="main" key="Me_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mh/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n28623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Jupiter, the goddess who presided over the physical condition of women</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; 7, 2.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28624" type="gloss" key="Mena3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 241</bibl>, col. 2.</sense></entryFree>
menaechmi: <entryFree id="n28625" type="main" key="Me^naechmi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnaechmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/naixmoi</foreign>, <sense id="n28625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comedy of Plautus, so called from the two twin brothers of this name, the leading characters</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
menaenius: <entryFree id="n28626" type="main" key="Me^naeni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnaenĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnaenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Menæ</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*me/nai</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a city of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mineo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xenon Menaenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:22:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 22, § 55</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnaeni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Menæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 102</bibl>; also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-nanīni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menaeus: <entryFree id="n28627" type="main" key="Me^naeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Menæ, in Sicily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitata Menaeis (viris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:266" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28628" type="greek" key="me_naeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēnaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhnai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n28628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monthly; subst</hi>. (sc. circulus), <hi rend="ital">a monthly circle</hi> (al. manacus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menalcas: <entryFree id="n28629" type="main" key="Me^nalcas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnalcas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menalippe: <entryFree id="n28630" type="main" key="Me^na^lippe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnălippē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnălippa, Mĕlă-nippē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menali/pph</foreign>, <sense id="n28630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sister of Antiope queen of the Amazons, taken prisoner by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:23" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 186" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28630.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tragedy of Attius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">and of Ennius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menalippus: <entryFree id="n28631" type="main" key="Me^na^lippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnălippus</orth> (orig. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕlănip-pus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mela/nippos</foreign>, <sense id="n28631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the slayer of Tydeus, who, while dying, bit the head of Menalippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:719" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 719</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">740</bibl>.—The form Melanippus is found as <hi rend="ital">the name of a tragedy of Attius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menalius: <entryFree id="n28632" type="spur" key="Menali^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Menalĭus</orth>, a false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl>; v. Creuz. ad loc.</entryFree>
menander: <entryFree id="n28633" type="main" key="Me^nander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnander</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnandros</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>; Gr. <sense id="n28633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Menandru, acc. to <foreign lang="greek">*mena/ndrou</foreign>, Ter. Eun., Heaut., and Ad.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/nandros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek comic poet, whom Terence took as his model</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:21:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 21, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis comoediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 4, 4</bibl>.—Form Menandros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">also Menandrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28633.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28633.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of T. Ampius Balbus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 70</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28633.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnandrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the poet Menander, Menandrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5</bibl> (6), 3.—</sense><sense id="n28633.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnandrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menanini: <entryFree id="n28634" type="main" key="Me^nani_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnanīni</orth>, v. Menaenius <sense id="n28634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
menapii: <entryFree id="n28635" type="main" key="Me^na^pi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnăpĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number> (Mĕnapis for Menapiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:54" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 54</bibl>), <sense id="n28635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Belgic Gaul, between the Meuse and the Scheldt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 749</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n28635.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnăpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the chief town of the Menapii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28635.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnăpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Menapii</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 14.</sense></entryFree>
menas: <entryFree id="n28636" type="main" key="Me_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēnas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mhna=s</foreign>, <sense id="n28636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedman of Sextus Pompeius, his lieutenant and commander of the pirate-fleet, which, with the hope of greater gain, he traitorously delivered up to Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:77" default="NO">77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 18, 58, § 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menceps: <entryFree id="n28637" type="gloss" key="menceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menceps</orth> <etym>for menteceptos, from mens and capio</etym>, <sense id="n28637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out of his senses, mad</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 668</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
menda: <entryFree id="n28638" type="main" key="menda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. mendum</etym>, <sense id="n28638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fault, defect, blemish</hi> of the body (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n28638.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in toto nusquam corpore menda fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte latent mendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 249</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28638.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mistake, error, blunder</hi>, in writing, in books, <hi rend="ital">a slip of the pen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendae istins indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:3" default="NO">1, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mendaciloquium: <entryFree id="n28639" type="gloss" key="menda_ci^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mendaciloquus</etym>, for mendacium, <sense id="n28639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false-speaking, falsehood, mendacity</hi>: mendaciloquium, <foreign lang="greek">yeudologi/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
mendaciloquus: <entryFree id="n28640" type="main" key="menda_ci^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mendacium-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n28640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false-speaking, lying, mendacious</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est stolidius, Neque mendaciloquius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 163</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a liar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendaciloquorum doctrinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MEND" /></sense></entryFree>
mendaciolum: <entryFree id="n28641" type="main" key="menda_ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. mendaciunculum.</entryFree>
mendacitas: <entryFree id="n28642" type="main" key="menda_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mendax</etym>, <sense id="n28642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false hood, mendacity</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mendaciter: <entryFree id="n28643" type="main" key="menda_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mendax <sense id="n28643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mendacium: <entryFree id="n28644" type="main" key="menda_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mendax</etym>, <sense id="n28644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lie, untruth, falsehood</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28644.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere alicui mendacium de re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacio fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:253" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:311" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa spirant mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titiae meae, cum quā sine mendacio vixi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>honestly, without hypocrisy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prophetāsti mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 20, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere mendacio,</quote> <trans><tr>to believe a lie</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,014:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Thess. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28644.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a fable, fiction</hi> (opp. historic truth): <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28644.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">a counterfeit</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque est imitabilior alia mendacio vitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 29, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mendaciunculum: <entryFree id="n28645" type="hapax" key="menda_ci^uncu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭuncŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mendacium</etym>, <sense id="n28645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little lie, trifling untruth, fib</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tamen est mendaciunculis aspergendum (al. mendaciolis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 241</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mendax: <entryFree id="n28646" type="main" key="mendax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendax</orth>, <itype>dācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mentior</etym>, <sense id="n28646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to lying, mendacious; subst., a liar</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacem esse adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mendaci homini, ne verum quidem dicenti, credere soleamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 71, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses fraudulenti et mendaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aretalogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 16</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendax</orth>, <itype>dācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a liar</hi>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacem memorem esse oportet,</quote> <trans><tr>a liar should have a good memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 91</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthis mendacior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 2, 1, 112</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>the greatest liar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hujus rei me mendacem esse inveneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe fui mendax pro te mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 35</bibl></cit>; for which <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 188</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenui farragine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28646.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim, and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">lying, false, deceptive; feigned, fictitious, counterfeit, not real</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 62, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <trans><tr>that does not yield the expected fruits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid Graecia mendax audet in historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 174</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">falsely, mendaciously</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 87</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacissime dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendes: <entryFree id="n28647" type="main" key="Mende_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mendēs</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mendēsīcus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mendēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Egyptian maritime town Mendes</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28647.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Mendes: <cit><quote lang="la">Asclepias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28647.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Mendesicus: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28647.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Mendesius: <cit><quote lang="la">nomos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendicabulum: <entryFree id="n28648" type="main" key="mendi_ca_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mendico</etym>, <sense id="n28648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beggar, mendicant</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum mendicabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumforaneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendicabundus: <entryFree id="n28649" type="main" key="mendi_ca_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">begging, mendicant</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mendicabundā prece stipem rogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 140" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendicatio: <entryFree id="n28650" type="main" key="mendi_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begging, obtaining by begging</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">foeda vitae mendicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendice: <entryFree id="n28651" type="main" key="mendi_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mendicus <sense id="n28651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mendicimonium: <entryFree id="n28652" type="main" key="mendi_ci^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mendicus</etym>, <sense id="n28652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beggary, indigence</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 2</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mendicitas: <entryFree id="n28653" type="main" key="mendi_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beggary, mendicity, pauperism, indigence</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui quidem ad mendicitatem properent se detrudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summā mendicitate esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendicitatem perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem novā mendicitate revocare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendico: <entryFree id="n28654" type="main" key="mendico"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendico</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n28654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum</itype> (archaio <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> mendicarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 13</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to beg, ask for alms, go a-begging; to beg for</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">solicit, obtain by begging;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> and with <case>acc.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): mendicantem vivere, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="1132" /> <cb n="MENE" /> <hi rend="ital">live by begging</hi>. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt 2, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando histrionem cogis mendicarier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 13; <cit><quote lang="la">mendicum malim mendicando vincere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me mendicas malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mendicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejectis mendicat silva Camenis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>is full of beggars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">mendicatus victa Karthagine panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:277" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 277</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendiculus: <entryFree id="n28655" type="main" key="mendi_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dim. adj.</hi> [mendicus], <hi rend="ital">of a beggar, beggarly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducula (opp. regilla),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendicum: <entryFree id="n28656" type="gloss" key="mendicum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendicum</orth>, <itype>velum quod in prora ponitur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
mendicus: <entryFree id="n28657" type="main" key="mendi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., beggarly, needy, in want, indigent</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28657.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas si malum est, mendicus esse beatus nemo potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solos sapientes esse, si mendicissimi (sint), divites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendicior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:81" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 81</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a beggar, mendicant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendicum malim mendicando vincere, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendici,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the priests of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—As a term of abuse, <hi rend="ital">a beggar, ragamuffin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28657.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">poor, paltry, mean, sorry, pitiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum mendicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendīcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a beggarly manner, meanly</hi> (post-Aug. and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non tam mendice tecum agam, sed plenā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mendicius patre coenaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendose: <entryFree id="n28658" type="main" key="mendo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mendosus <sense id="n28658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mendositas: <entryFree id="n28659" type="main" key="mendo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mendosus</etym>, <sense id="n28659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faultiness</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mendositatem corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 71:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 71, 5</bibl></cit>; id. Civ. Dei, 15, 13.</sense></entryFree>
mendosus: <entryFree id="n28660" type="main" key="mendo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mendum</etym>. <sense id="n28660.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of faults, fauity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28660.1" n="A" level="2"> Physically, <hi rend="ital">full of faults</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blemishes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 399</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28660.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">erroneous, incorrect</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mendosum exemplar testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendosum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia mendosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28660.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28660.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That commits faults, makes mistakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur servus societatis, qui tabulas conficeret, semper in Verrucii nomine certo ex loco mendosus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28660.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">False, deceptive</hi>: mendosum for mendose, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">falsely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendosum tinnire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:106" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mendōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">full of faults, faultily, falsely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">libri mendose scribuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendose colligis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:85" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 85</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars mendosissime scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mendum: <entryFree id="n28661" type="main" key="mendum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mendum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. manāk, a little; mindā, a defect; cf.: mancus, mendicus</etym>, <sense id="n28661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fault, error, blunder</hi> in writing (class.). </sense><sense id="n28661.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mendum ista litura correxit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28661.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Idus Martiae magnum mendum continent, <hi rend="ital">mistake, error</hi>, Cic <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:14:22:2" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 14, 22, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28661.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A blemish, defect</hi>, in the face, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rara tamen mendo facies caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 261</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menecles: <entryFree id="n28662" type="main" key="Me^ne^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕcles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meneklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n28662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Asiatic rhetorician from Alabanda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-nĕclĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Menecles the rhetorician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Meneclium studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menecrates: <entryFree id="n28663" type="main" key="Me^necra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnecrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menekra/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n28663.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poet of Ephesus, who wrote of husbandry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28663.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 18, 58, § 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menedemus: <entryFree id="n28664" type="hapax" key="Me^ne^de_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕdēmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mene/dhmos</foreign>. <sense id="n28664.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Eretrian philosopher, a disciple of Plato</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28664.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian rhetorician in the time of Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28664.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A peripatetic philosopher from Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28664.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek admitted to the privileges of citizenship, but afterwards executed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 19, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28664.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A general of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:15" default="NO">7, 7, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28664.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a man, one of the</hi> Dramatis Personae <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Ter. Heaut.</sense></entryFree>
menelaeus: <entryFree id="n28665" type="main" key="Me^ne^la_e_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕlāēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Menelaüs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 7), 14.</sense></entryFree>
