menelais: <entryFree id="n28666" type="hapax" key="Menela_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Menelāis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26</bibl>. <cb n="MENO" /></sense></entryFree>
menelaites: <entryFree id="n28667" type="main" key="Me^ne^la_ites"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕlāites</orth>, <sense id="n28667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 9, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menelaius: <entryFree id="n28668" type="hapax" key="Me^ne^lai^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕlaĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Laconia, on the Eurotas, near Sparta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menelaus: <entryFree id="n28669" type="main" key="Me^ne^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕlāüs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mene/laos</foreign>. <sense id="n28669.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Atreus, brother of Agamemnon, and husband of Helen, who eloped from him with Paris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 21, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 359</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28669.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cuckold</hi>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Jestingly of M. Lucullus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose wife was seduced by C. Memmius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28669.2" n="II" level="1"> Menelaus Marathenus, <hi rend="ital">a Greek rhetorician, from the old Phoenician city of Marathus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28669.3" n="III" level="1"> Menelai portus, <hi rend="ital">a city with a port of the same name on the shore of the Mediterranean, between Cyrene and Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 6</bibl>; also called Menelaita urbs, Edict. Justin. 13, 9, 2.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnĕlāĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Menelaus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl> (3, 7), 14.</sense></entryFree>
menenianus: <entryFree id="n28670" type="main" key="Me^ne_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnēnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, see the foll. art. II. B.</entryFree>
menenius: <entryFree id="n28671" type="main" key="Me^ne_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnēnĭus</orth>, <sense id="n28671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. <hi rend="ital">Its most celebrated member was</hi> Menenius Agrippa, <hi rend="ital">who told the people the fable of the belly and the limbs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 32, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 33, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Another</hi> Menenius <hi rend="ital">in the time of Horace, noted as a foolish person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 287</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28671.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n28671.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnēnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Menenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman tribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28671.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnēnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Menenius, Menenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Menenius Agrippa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menephron: <entryFree id="n28672" type="main" key="Me^ne_^phron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnē^phron</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menefrwn</foreign>, <sense id="n28672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an immoral person</hi>, Ov M. 7, 386; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnō^phrus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 253" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 253</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menerva: <entryFree id="n28673" type="gloss" key="Me^nerva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnerva</orth>, v. Minerva <sense id="n28673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
menestheus: <entryFree id="n28674" type="hapax" key="Me^nestheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnestheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-steus</orth>), <itype>ei and eos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menesqeus</foreign>, <sense id="n28674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man's name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28674.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Iphicrates the Athenian</hi>, Nep. lphicr. 3.— </sense><sense id="n28674.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Athenians, a leader in the Trojan war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28674.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A charioteer of Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:661" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 661</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">712</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28674.4" n="IV" level="1"> = Mnestheus, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
menia: <entryFree id="n28675" type="main" key="Me_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēnĭa Cŏlumna</orth>, v. Maenius.</entryFree>
menianum: <entryFree id="n28676" type="main" key="Me_ni^a_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēnĭānum</orth>, v. Maen-.</entryFree>
meninga: <entryFree id="n28677" type="greek" key="me_ninga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēninga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh=nigc</foreign>, <sense id="n28677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the membrane which covers the brain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meninx: <entryFree id="n28678" type="main" key="Me_ninx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēninx</orth>, <itype>ngis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mh=nigc</foreign>, <sense id="n28678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island off the coast of Africa, near the Lesser Syrtis</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Jerbah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 7, 7, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 31, 2</bibl> (Weissenb. Menige); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:318" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 318</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menion: <entryFree id="n28679" type="main" key="me_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant, also called</hi> menogenion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menippeus: <entryFree id="n28680" type="main" key="Me^nippe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnippĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Menippus.</entryFree>
menippus: <entryFree id="n28681" type="main" key="Me^nippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/nippos</foreign>. <sense id="n28681.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Cynic philosopher famous for his bitter sarcasms, whence Varro gave to his satires the name of</hi> Menippeae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 207</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28681.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A great Asiatic orator in the time of Cicero, from Stratonice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:315" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 315</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menis: <entryFree id="n28682" type="greek" key="me_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little halfmoon, crescent</hi>, placed as an ornament at the beginning of books (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">a primā menide libri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the beginning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 25, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menius: <entryFree id="n28683" type="hapax" key="Me_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mh/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n28683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Lycaon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:472" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 472</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mennis: <entryFree id="n28684" type="hapax" key="Mennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mennis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Assyria, in Adiabene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mennonia: <entryFree id="n28685" type="hapax" key="mennoni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mennonĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a reading for memnonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.</entryFree>
menoeceus: <entryFree id="n28686" type="main" key="Me^noeceus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnoeceus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menoikeus</foreign>, <sense id="n28686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of the Theban king Creon, who sacrificed kimself for his country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:240" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:620" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 620</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">651</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 709 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 67" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 67</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnoecĕus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Menœceus, Menœcean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:756" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 756</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menoetes: <entryFree id="n28687" type="hapax" key="Me^noetes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnoetes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <case>acc.</case> <itype>en</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menoi/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n28687.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Æneas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellat voce Menoetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28687.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Arcadian slain by Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 517</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menoetius: <entryFree id="n28688" type="main" key="Me^noeti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnoetĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menoi/tios</foreign>, <sense id="n28688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Actor and father of Patroclus, one of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl> and 97.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnoetĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*menoitia/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <cb n="MENS" /> <hi rend="ital">son of Menœtius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Patroclus, the friend of Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menogenes: <entryFree id="n28689" type="main" key="Me_no^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēnŏgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman sur name</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the consul</hi> M. Messala, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28689.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menogenion: <entryFree id="n28690" type="greek" key="me_noge^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēnogĕnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/nh</foreign> (moon) and <foreign lang="greek">ge/neion</foreign> (chin), <sense id="n28690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant good for the cure of somnambulism</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menoides: <entryFree id="n28691" type="greek" key="me_no^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mēnŏīdes</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">mhnoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the moon during her first days, the new moon</hi>, Firm. Math. 4 praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
menon: <entryFree id="n28692" type="greek" key="Me^no_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕnōn</orth>, ōnis. <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/nwn</foreign>, <sense id="n28692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of one of Plato's dialogues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menotyrannus: <entryFree id="n28693" type="greek" key="Me_no^ty^rannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mēnŏtyrannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhnotu/ rannos</foreign>, <sense id="n28693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lord of the months</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 666, 522</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 28, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
mens: <entryFree id="n28694" type="main" key="mens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mens</orth>, <itype>mentis</itype> (<sense id="n28694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> mentis: terra corpus est, at mentis ignis est, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 764</bibl> P.; so too, istic est de sole sumptus; isque totus mentis est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 59</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 168, v. 6</bibl> and 7 Vahl.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from the root men, whence memini, q. v., and comminiscor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the mind, disposition; the heart, soul</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28694.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: fusi sine mente ac sine sensu ullo jaceant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 312, 26</bibl> (Ann. v. 134 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nubilam mentem Animi habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens animi vigilat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala mens, malus animus,</quote> <trans><tr>bad disposition, bad heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum erga se mentes,</quote> <trans><tr>feelings, sentiments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens mollis ad calamitates perferendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanae mentis vitium ... saeva cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28694.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n28694.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The conscience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vero jurato sententia dicenda est, meminerit, deum se adhibere testem, id est ut ego arbitror, mentem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor, cui frigida mens est crimi nibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos diri conscia fact, Mens habet attonitos et surdo verbere caedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:194" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28694.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The intellectual faculties, the mind, understanding, intellect, reason, judgment, discernment, consideration, reflection</hi>, etc.: mens, cui regnum totius animi (<hi rend="ital">soul</hi>) a naturā tributum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ita est constitutus, ut habeat praestantiam mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum mente atque ratione omnem mundum administrari et regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente complecti aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to comprehend, understand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanum mentis esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be of sound mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens sana in corpore sano, Juv 10, 356: mentis suae esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in one's right mind, in one's senses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mentis compotem esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: captus mente, <hi rend="ital">out of his senses, beside himself, mad</hi> (cf. menceps), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 4</bibl>, a, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose one's mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15</bibl></cit>. 31: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis inops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic ex tempore dicenti effluit mens,</quote> <trans><tr>his recollection vanished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:218" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 61, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est tam vecors, qui ea, quae tanta mente fiunt, casu putet posse fieri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis dent mentem oportet (di), ut prohibeatis, sicut mihi dederunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi istuc in mentem venit?</quote> <trans><tr>what comes into your mind? what are you thinking of?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo hercle in mentem venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit hoc mihi in mentem, te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit in mentem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 31</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserae ubi venit in mentem mortis metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi venere in mentem calliditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiescumque patria in mentem veniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ea res tibi tam belle in mentem venire potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 55</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (so mostly in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">non minus saepe ei venit in mentem potestatis, quam aequitatis tuae,</quote> <trans><tr>he bethought himself of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi tuarum virtutum veniat in mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 2, 61, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit mihi Platonis in mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet mihi in mentem venire illius temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28694.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mind, thought, plan, purpose, intention, design</hi>. quā facere id possis, nostram nunc accipe mentem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 676</bibl>: ut nemini dubium esse debeat, quin reliquo tempore eādem mente sim futurus, <pb n="1133" /> <cb n="MENS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella classem eā mente comparavit, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes deorum scrutari in fibris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro percussit, sed non occidendi mente, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 1, 6, 3: poenae modus ex mente facientis statui potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mente est mihi dormire,</quote> <trans><tr>I have a mind to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28694.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Spirit, boldness, courage</hi>: addere mentem, <hi rend="ital">to give courage to</hi>, Hor Ep. 2, 2, 36: <cit><quote lang="la">demittunt mentes,</quote> <trans><tr>lose courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 609</bibl></cit> (cf. animus).—</sense><sense id="n28694.7" n="E" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mens</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of thought, whose festival was held on the eighth of June</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menti aedem T. Octacilius praetor vovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:241" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 241</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensa: <entryFree id="n28695" type="main" key="mensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n28695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [Sanscr, ma, measure; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/tron;</foreign> cf. manus, mane, etc.], <hi rend="ital">a table</hi> for any purpose, as <hi rend="ital">a dining-table; a market-stand</hi> for meat, vegetables, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a money-dealer's table</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counter, a sacrificial table</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n28695.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Of the table itself as a fabrid: <cit><quote lang="la">non ferre mensam nisi crebris distinctam venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Dial. 3:35:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Dial. 3, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa inanis nunc si adponatur mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos in mensam alicui apponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgunt a mensā saturi, poti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: ad mensam consistere. <hi rend="ital">to wait at table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud mensam,</quote> <trans><tr>at table</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO">19, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae vicem praestare posse mensam dicatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28695.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Food; a table, meal, course</hi>: quocum mensam sermonesque suos impertit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 240 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">communicabo te semper mensā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mensas exstruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parciore mensā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italicae Syracusiaeque mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui Quintus de mensa misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">parāsti mensam adversus eos qui tribulant me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una mensa,</quote> <trans><tr>at a single meal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 138</bibl></cit>: prior, proxima mensa, <hi rend="ital">the first, the second rank at table; the first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">second in esteem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Raeticis uvis prior mensa erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 63</bibl>: secunda mensa, <hi rend="ital">the second course, the dessert</hi> (at which much wine was used), Cels 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te scripsi, appositā secundā mensā,</quote> <trans><tr>during the dessert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agesilaus coronas secundamque mensam servis dispertiit, Nep Ages. 8, 4: secunda mensa bono stomacho nihil nocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>meal-time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:211" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 211</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The guests at table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primum istorum conduxit mensa choragum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A money-changer's counter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem minas dum hic solvit, omnis mensas transiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam poni jubet atque Effundi saccos nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummulariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <trans><tr>a public bank</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A butcher's table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa lanionia,</quote> <trans><tr>butcher's stall, shambles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.7" n="E" level="2"> Mensa lusoria, <hi rend="ital">a gaming-table</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28695.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sacrificial table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curiales mensae, in quibus immolabatur Junoni, quae Curis est appellata, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Curiales, p. 64 Müll.: mensae deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 764</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 105</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">a small altar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tumulum statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.9" n="G" level="1"> The long flat part, <hi rend="ital">the table</hi>, of a military engine (e. g. of a catapult), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28695.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">platform</hi> on which slaves were exposed for sale: <cit><quote lang="la">servus de mensā paratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 17, p. 285, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensalis: <entryFree id="n28696" type="main" key="mensa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensa</etym>, <sense id="n28696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the table, table-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">argentum mensale,</quote> <trans><tr>silver table-service</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 10</bibl></cit>: vinum, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae species mensalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 479, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mensarius: <entryFree id="n28697" type="main" key="mensa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the table</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counter;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28697.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mensārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a money-changer, banker</hi> </sense><sense id="n28697.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: mensaril nummularii, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124, 17</bibl> Müll.: Cassius Parmens. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28697.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a public banker</hi>, who regulated the paying out of public moneys, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinqueviris creatis, quos mensarlos ab dispensatione pecuniae appellārunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensarii triumviri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28697.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mensārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">table furniture, a table-cloth</hi>: collarium, quod in collo est.: <cb n="MENS" /> mensarium, quod in mensā est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 590</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
mensatim: <entryFree id="n28698" type="main" key="mensa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mensa</etym>, <sense id="n28698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by tables, from table to table</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 214</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensio: <entryFree id="n28699" type="hapax" key="mensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>metior</etym>, <sense id="n28699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring, measure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <trans><tr>metre, quantity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:177" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mensis: <entryFree id="n28700" type="main" key="mensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n28700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> regularly mensium; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. mensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 74, 182 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 500</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">424</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 9, § 49</bibl> et saep.; v. Neue, Formenl. 1. p. 265 sq.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root ma-, measure; Sanscr mas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mhn</foreign>, the measure of time; cf. Goth. mena; Germ. Mond; Engl. moon, month</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a month</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensium nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.; Censor 22: hunc mensem vortentem servare, <hi rend="ital">the return of this month</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a full year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem menses sunt. quom in hasce aedis pedem nemo mtro tulit, id Most. 2, 2, 39: lunae cursus qui, quia mensa spatia conficiunt, menses nominantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D 2, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: annūm novūm voluerunt esse primum mensem Martium, Atta ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo mense,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of the month</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnavit is quidem paucos menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; Hor C. 2, 9, 6.—</sense><sense id="n28700.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">plur., the months</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the fixed time, the period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis jam tibi actos vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28700.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, esp. in <hi rend="ital">plur., the menses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodest mulierum mensibus retardatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 40, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:147" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 71, § 147</bibl>; 23, 7, 71, § 138 et saep.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">a muliere incitati mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 23, § 77</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of female animals, <hi rend="ital">the yearly flux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
mensor: <entryFree id="n28701" type="main" key="mensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>metior</etym>, <sense id="n28701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measurer</hi> (post Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28701.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">te maris, et terrae, numeroque carentis arenae Mensorem cohibent, Archyta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a corn-measurer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Dig. 27, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28701.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n28701.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surveyor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non agricolae sed mensoris officium esse dicebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautus humum longo signavit limite mensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 136</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28701.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An architect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28701.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28701.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An engineer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28701.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who measures out the ground for an encampment, a quartermaster</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>, Cod. Th. 7, 8, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3473</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensorium: <entryFree id="n28702" type="main" key="menso_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mensor</etym>, <sense id="n28702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basket</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput Johannis in mensorio accipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. E. 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menstrua: <entryFree id="n28703" type="main" key="menstru^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. menstruus.</entryFree>
menstrualis: <entryFree id="n28704" type="main" key="menstru^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>menstruus</etym>, <sense id="n28704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monthly, every month, for a month.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28704.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>free entertainment for a month</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: sphaera, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 538.—</sense><sense id="n28704.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the monthly courses</hi> of women, <hi rend="ital">menstrual</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">solum animal menstruale mulier est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier men strualis,</quote> <trans><tr>menstrual</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev 15, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
menstruo: <entryFree id="n28705" type="main" key="menstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n28705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n28705.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to have a monthly term, to be men struant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier menstruans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28705.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to pollute;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pannus menstruatae justitiae nostrae,</quote> <trans><tr>polluted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:64:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 64, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 18, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
menstruum: <entryFree id="n28706" type="main" key="menstru^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. menstruus.</entryFree>
menstruus: <entryFree id="n28707" type="main" key="menstru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis</etym>. <sense id="n28707.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a month, that happens every month, monthly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28707.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferias menstruas edicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">usura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28707.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28707.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the monthly sacri fices</hi>: ad menstrua solvenda montem ascendunt, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 32</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28707.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">menstruum meum Calend Septembr finitur,</quote> <trans><tr>a monthly term of office, monthly service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28707.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to monthly purgations, to menstruation, menstruous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">menstruae purgationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 15, 25</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">menstrŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">monthly purgations, menses, catamenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6</bibl>, <cb n="MENS" /> 6, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 154</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 78</bibl>.—Of female animals: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans><tr>menstruous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28707.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That lasts a month, for the space of a month, monthly</hi>: vita menstrua. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>: menstrua cibaria. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:30:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 30, § 72</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">men-strŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a month's provisions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensualis: <entryFree id="n28708" type="main" key="mensu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis</etym>, <sense id="n28708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a month, monthly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus, Gromat. Vet. p. 393, 12: speculatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 415, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Contin. Virg. p. 142, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mensula: <entryFree id="n28709" type="main" key="mensu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little table</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 11, p. 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensularius: <entryFree id="n28710" type="main" key="mensu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mensula</etym>, <sense id="n28710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a money-changer</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:24:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:24:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 5, 24, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:47:section=1" default="NO">2, 11, 47, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensura: <entryFree id="n28711" type="main" key="mensu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūra</orth>. <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>metior</etym>, <sense id="n28711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring, measure</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28711.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuram facere alicujus, Ov A. A. 3, 265: agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to measure, survey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire. Col 5, 3: res (quae) pondere numero mensura constant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:196" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28711.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a measure</hi>, by which any thing is measured: <cit><quote lang="la">majore mensurā reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modus mensurae medimnus appellatur,</quote> <trans><tr>kind of measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuras et pondera invenit Phidon Argivus, aut Palamedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aquā, i. e. clepsydra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid sub aurium mensuram aliquam cadit, numerus vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mensura jus dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 101</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28711.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">measure, quantity, proportion, capacity, power, extent, degree</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui mensuram bibendi,</quote> <trans><tr>to prescribe how much one may drink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tanti mensuram nominis imples,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who answerest to its meaning, art worthy of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficti crescit,</quote> <trans><tr>measure, size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 57</bibl></cit>: sui, <hi rend="ital">one's own measure</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">capacity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed deerat pisci patinae mensura,</quote> <trans><tr>was too small</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 72</bibl></cit>: nuribus Argolicis fui Mensura voti, <hi rend="ital">I was the measure of their wishes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">they desired to have as much as I possessed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 400" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">submittere se ad mensuram discentis,</quote> <trans><tr>to accommodate one's self to the capacity of the learner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: legati, <hi rend="ital">character, standing</hi>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensura tamen quae sufficiat census,</quote> <trans><tr>how large a fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14</bibl></cit>. 316.—In painting: <cit><quote lang="la">Apelles cedebat Asclepiodoro de mensuris, hoc est quanto quid a quoque distare deberet,</quote> <trans><tr>the degree of prominence, and relative distances, of parts of a picture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>.—In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">mensurae verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>the quantities of their syllables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mensurabilis: <entryFree id="n28712" type="main" key="mensu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensura</etym>, <sense id="n28712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be measured, measurable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 881</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">men-sūrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., measurably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Specul. 20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Specul. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensuralis: <entryFree id="n28713" type="main" key="mensu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to measuring, measuring-</hi> (post-class.): mensuralis linea, Sicul. Fl. p. 19 Goes.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūrālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Varro</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 817</bibl> P.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by measure</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. p. 167" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. p. 167</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
mensuratio: <entryFree id="n28714" type="main" key="mensu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mensuro</etym>, <sense id="n28714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring, mensuration</hi> (post-class.): jugeri, Auct. de Limit. p. 264 Goes.: agrorum, Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 3, 5; p. 379, 12 Halm.</sense></entryFree>
mensurator: <entryFree id="n28715" type="main" key="mensu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūrātor</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measurer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensurnus: <entryFree id="n28716" type="main" key="mensurnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensurnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis</etym>, <sense id="n28716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monthly</hi> (for the more usual menstruus): spatium, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl> (acc. to Prisc. p 595 P.; B. and K. menstrui spatii); so Novat. de Trinit.: divisiones. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensuro: <entryFree id="n28717" type="main" key="mensu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mensura</etym>, <sense id="n28717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to measure</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fossa mensuratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Gromat. Vet. p. 232, 9: fines, Hilar. in Psa. 15, 8: longitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">48, 30 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n28717.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to measure, estimate</hi>: suas opes viresque suorum, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:372" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 372</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mensūratē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., by measurement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 69, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mensus: <entryFree id="n28718" type="main" key="mensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from metior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28719" type="main" key="mensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mensus</orth>. ūs (only in <sense id="n28719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <pb n="1134" /> <cb n="MENT" /> [metior], <hi rend="ital">a measuring, measure</hi>, v. l. ap. App. de Mundo, p. 253 dub.</sense></entryFree>
menta: <entryFree id="n28720" type="greek" key="menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mentha</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi/nth</foreign>, <sense id="n28720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mint</hi>, acc. to the myth, so called from Menthe or Minthe, a nymph who was changed by Proserpine into this plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 729</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 47, § 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ructatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens, Col. poët. 10, 119. —Prov.: decimatis mentham et rutam et omne olus, et praeteritis judicium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>carefully attend to trifles and neglect weighty matters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 23, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentagra: <entryFree id="n28721" type="main" key="menta_^gra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentā^gra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mentum - <foreign lang="greek">a)/gra</foreign>, formed after pod-agra; lit., chin-disease</etym>, <sense id="n28721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eruption, tetter on the chin</hi> (i. q. lichen, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 2, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentalis: <entryFree id="n28722" type="main" key="menta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mens</etym>, <sense id="n28722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mental</hi> (late Lat.): mentalibus oculis, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Frat. Erem. Serm. 19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Frat. Erem. Serm. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentastrum: <entryFree id="n28723" type="main" key="mentastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>menta</etym>, <sense id="n28723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild mint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 47, § 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mentesanus: <entryFree id="n28724" type="main" key="Mente_sa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mentēsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n28724.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of</hi> Mentesa (Mentissa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17</bibl>) <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Baetica: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo Mentesanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 384, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mentesani Bastuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28724.1" n="II" level="1"> Mentesani Oretani in Hispaniā Tarraconensi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentha: <entryFree id="n28725" type="main" key="mentha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentha</orth>, v. menta.</entryFree>
mentiens: <entryFree id="n28726" type="main" key="menti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from mentior, q. v.</entryFree>
mentigo: <entryFree id="n28727" type="main" key="menti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mentum</etym>, <sense id="n28727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eruption, scab</hi>, on lambs (i. q. ostigo, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentio: <entryFree id="n28728" type="main" key="menti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from root man-, men-; v. memini</etym>, <sense id="n28728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling to mind, a cursory speaking of, a making mention, mentioning, naming, mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu in eorum mentionem incidi,</quote> <trans><tr>accidentally happened to mention them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <trans><tr>mention of you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 114</bibl></cit>.—With a foll. <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem fecit, ut reperirem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentione illatā a tribunis, ut liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem facere alicujus rei,</quote> <trans><tr>to make mention of a thing, mention it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo feci supra mentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem movere alicujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem habere accusatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make mention of, to mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem rei incohare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem condicionum jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: mentionem facere, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., to mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli facere mentionem, te has emisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatu consules faciunt mentionem, placere statui, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentio in senatu facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua de re tecum mentionem feceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac mentionem cum avonculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mentionem ego fecero de puellā, mihi ut despondeat,</quote> <trans><tr>to propose for a girl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessionis mentiones ad vulgus militum sermonibus occultis serere,</quote> <trans><tr>suggestions, hints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 43, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28729" type="main" key="menti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentĭo</orth>, <itype>ire, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (archaic collat. form of mentior, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 6, 29, p. 799</bibl> P.): <sense id="n28729.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">te mentire spirito sancto, v. l. for mentiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; for mentitus, <hi rend="ital">pass. part.</hi>, v. mentior <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 297 sq.</sense></entryFree>
mentior: <entryFree id="n28730" type="main" key="menti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype> (<sense id="n28730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> mentibitur, for mentietur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 99</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 448), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [prob. from root men-, whence mens, memini, q. v. Original meaning, to invent; hence], </sense><sense id="n28730.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to lie, cheat, deceive</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiri palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo veritatis diligens, ut ne joco quidem mentiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., to pretend, to declare falsely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certam me sum mentitus habere Horam, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 34, § 67</bibl>: mentior nisi or si mentior, a form of asseveration, <hi rend="ital">I am a liar, if</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentior, nisi et quae alunt illud, corpora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mentiar, inquit, Ultima, quā fallam, sit Venus illa mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:227" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 227</bibl></cit>.—Of things, <hi rend="ital">to deceive, impose upon</hi>: frons, oculi, vultus persaepe<cb n="MEO" />  mentiuntur, oratio vero saepissime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus nihil umquam ... vetustas mentita sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28730.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deceive one's self, mistake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentire, gnate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 83</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n28730.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to lie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">speak falsely about, to assert falsely, make a false promise about; to feign, counterfeit, imitate</hi> a shape, nature, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus consilio tantam rem mentitus esset,</quote> <trans><tr>had devised such a falsehood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">originem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 35, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titulum Lyciscae,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume falsely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem,</quote> <trans><tr>to promise falsely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur sese daemonia mentiuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 23</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">to invent, feign</hi>, of a poetical fiction: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mentitur (sc. Homerus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 151</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae Orionem mentiuntur in pelago incidentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si a debitore, praelato die, pignoris obligatio mentiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28730.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of inanim. subjects: semel fac illud, Mentitur tua quod subinde tussis, <hi rend="ital">do what your cough keeps falsely promising</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiris juvenem tinctis capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:43:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color, qui chrysocollam mentitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 29, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec varios discet mentiri lana colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: sexum viris denegatum muliebri motu, Col. praef. 1.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n28730.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mentĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst., a fallacy, sophism</hi>: quomodo mentientem, quem <foreign lang="greek">yeudo/menon</foreign> vocant, dissolvas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 4, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28730.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mentītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, in pass. signif., <hi rend="ital">imitated, counterfeit, feigned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mentita tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:439" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 439</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 512</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:698" default="NO"><author>Val.
