Fl.</author> 6, 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:155" default="NO">7, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:796" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 796</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 875</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiti fictique terrores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 81, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentiosus: <entryFree id="n28731" type="main" key="menti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>menta</etym>, <sense id="n28731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smelling strong of mint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentissa: <entryFree id="n28732" type="main" key="Mentissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mentissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Mentesanus.</entryFree>
mentitio: <entryFree id="n28733" type="hapax" key="menti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mentior</etym>, <sense id="n28733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying, deception</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
mentitus: <entryFree id="n28734" type="main" key="menti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. mentior <sense id="n28734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
mento: <entryFree id="n28735" type="main" key="mento1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n28735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [mentum], <hi rend="ital">one who has a long chin, long-chin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28736" type="main" key="Mento2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n28736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>. So C. Julius Mento, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 323, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mentonomon: <entryFree id="n28737" type="hapax" key="Mentono^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mentonŏmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of the shore of the German Ocean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 35</bibl> (better reading Metonomon, Jan.).</sense></entryFree>
mentor: <entryFree id="n28738" type="main" key="Mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mentor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/ntwr</foreign>. <sense id="n28738.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The famous friend of Odysseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28738.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated artist in embossed work in metal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 53, § 147</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28738.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a Mentor-cup</hi>, a skilfully wrought drinking-vessel: <cit><quote lang="la">rarae sine Mentore mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mentora frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:11:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mentŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mentor the artist, Mentorean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:39:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 39, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mentula: <entryFree id="n28739" type="main" key="mentu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, i. q. membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 20, 18, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:115:8" default="NO" valid="yes">115, 8</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:23:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 23, 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
mentulatus: <entryFree id="n28740" type="main" key="mentu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mentula</etym>, <sense id="n28740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a</hi> mentula (rare).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priapo mentulatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mentum: <entryFree id="n28741" type="main" key="mentum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root men-, min-, to project; cf.: minae, minari, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n28741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chin</hi> of persons and animals; also, the chin with the hair that grows on it, <hi rend="ital">the beard</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28741.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis mentum paulo attritius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28741.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in archit., <hi rend="ital">the projecting part of a cornice</hi>, which casts off the rain, <hi rend="ital">the coping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28742" type="gloss" key="mentum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mentum</orth> <itype>dicebant, quod nos commentum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
menui: <entryFree id="n28743" type="main" key="menui"><orth extent="full" lang="la">menui</orth>, <sense id="n28743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Indian name of a precious stone which the Greeks called</hi> xanthos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meo: <entryFree id="n28744" type="main" key="me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. mī, to go</etym>, <sense id="n28744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go, to pass</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quo simul meāris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orientem meavisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meantes exercitus terrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28744.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things: ita ut vix singula meent plaustra, <cb n="MERC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 14, 17, § 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triremes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapor per inane vacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima diversa in membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 640</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meopte: <entryFree id="n28745" type="main" key="meopte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">meopte</orth>, i. e. meo ipsius, v. meus.</entryFree>
mephiticus: <entryFree id="n28746" type="main" key="me^phi_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕphītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mephitis</etym>, <sense id="n28746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mephitic, pestilential</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mephitis: <entryFree id="n28747" type="main" key="me^phi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕphītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noxious, pestilential exhalation from the ground, mephitis</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28747.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevamque exhalat opaca mephitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:99" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28747.2" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕphītis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mĕfi-tis</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess who averts pestilential exhalations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1795</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus Mephitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:7:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 7, § 49</bibl></cit> Müll.: aedes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:351:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 351, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mepte: <entryFree id="n28748" type="main" key="mepte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mepte</orth>, i. e. me ipsum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 8, 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
merace: <entryFree id="n28749" type="main" key="me^ra_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrācē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. meracus <sense id="n28749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
meraculus: <entryFree id="n28750" type="main" key="me^ra_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrācŭlus</orth> (also sync., meraclus), a, um, <sense id="n28750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [meracus], <hi rend="ital">pretty pure, with very little mixture</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">meraclo se percussit flore Libyco (al. meraco),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 19, 80, § 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meracus: <entryFree id="n28751" type="main" key="me^ra_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merus</etym>, <sense id="n28751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pure, unmixed</hi>, esp. of wine (class.). </sense><sense id="n28751.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum meracius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 27.—</sense><sense id="n28751.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">helleborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28751.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meracissimus scientiae fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrācē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">purely, without mixture</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">minus, sed meracius bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">purius, meracius amare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meralis: <entryFree id="n28752" type="hapax" key="me^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pure, unmixed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meratus: <entryFree id="n28753" type="main" key="me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, i. q. meracus, <sense id="n28753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Chron. 1:1:17 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Chron. 1, 1, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
mercabilis: <entryFree id="n28754" type="main" key="merca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mercor</etym>, <sense id="n28754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be bought, purchasable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mercalis: <entryFree id="n28755" type="main" key="merca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merx</etym>, for mercabilis, <sense id="n28755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be bought, purchasable</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mercans: <entryFree id="n28756" type="main" key="mercans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n28756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. mercor.</sense></entryFree>
mercantia: <entryFree id="n28757" type="main" key="mercantia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercantia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mercor</etym>, <sense id="n28757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trade</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mercatilla: <entryFree id="n28758" type="main" key="Merca_tilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercātilla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercantilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Iscriz. Alb. p. 73; Inscr. Mur. 1691, 6.</sense></entryFree>
mercatio: <entryFree id="n28759" type="main" key="merca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mercor</etym>, <sense id="n28759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealing in wares, mercantile dealing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia in mercationibus perdita,</quote> <trans><tr>in mercantile speculations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; Firm. Math. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mercator: <entryFree id="n28760" type="main" key="merca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trader, merchant</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a wholesale dealer</hi> (opp. to caupo, a retailer; class.). </sense><sense id="n28760.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalicii mercatoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi ad eos mercatores ventitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n28760.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28760.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dealer, speculator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non consules, sed mercatores provinciarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of <hi rend="ital">a petty dealer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilis sacci mercator olentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:269" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 269</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28760.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A buyer, purchaser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mercatorius: <entryFree id="n28761" type="main" key="merca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mercator</etym>, <sense id="n28761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mercantile</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">navis mercatoria,</quote> <trans><tr>a merchant-vessel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mercatura: <entryFree id="n28762" type="main" key="merca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mercor</etym>, <sense id="n28762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trade, traffic, commerce</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28762.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mercatura autem, si tenuis est, sordida putanda est; <cit><quote lang="la">sin magna et copiosa, non est admodum vituperanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercaturas facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow the pursuits of trade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28762.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ad quos cum tanquam ad mercaturam bonarum artium sis profectus, <hi rend="ital">to the purchase of</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28762.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">goods, wares, merchandise</hi> (ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mercatus: <entryFree id="n28763" type="main" key="merca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trade, traffic, buying and selling</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">apud aedem Veneris mercatus meretricius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissimus mercatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28763.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place for trade, market-place.</hi> <pb n="1135" /> <cb n="MERC" /> <hi rend="ital">market, mart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam pater ad mercatum abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens mercatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatus conventusque Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatu indicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae Graeciaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa Pompilius) mercatus ludos omnesque conveniendi causas et celebritates invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28763.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a festival assemblage, public feast</hi>, transl. of the Greek <foreign lang="greek">panh/guris</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatus is qui habetur maximo ludorum apparatu, totius Graeciae celebritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mercatu Olympiaco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae Graeciaeque is mercatus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pars Italiae stato in eosdem dies mercatu congregata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mercedarius: <entryFree id="n28764" type="gloss" key="merce_da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēdārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>merces</etym>, <sense id="n28764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who pays wages</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostende mercedarios tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33, 5</bibl></cit> and 25; cf. Gloss. Isid. s. v., ‡ 1. mercedonius.</sense></entryFree>
mercedituum: <entryFree id="n28765" type="gloss" key="merce_ditu^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēditŭum</orth>, <itype>mercenarium, quod mercede se tueatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
mercedonius:
<entryFree id="n28766" type="gloss" key="merce_do^ni^us" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. merces-do</etym>, <sense id="n28766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the payment of wages</hi>: Mercedonios (dies) dixerunt a mercede solvendā, <hi rend="ital">on which wages are paid, pay-days</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n28766.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a payer of wages, paymaster</hi>: mercedonius, qui solvit mercedem; ‡ mercedarius (<hi rend="ital">an employer</hi>), qui dat mercedem pro labore sibi impenso, <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Isid.</author> 37</bibl>.</sense>
‡† <sense id="n28766.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercēdŏnĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercēdī-nus</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*merkhdo/nios, *merkedi=nos</foreign>, mensis, <hi rend="ital">an intercalary month of</hi> 22 <hi rend="ital">or</hi> 23 <hi rend="ital">days, inserted every two years in the calendar of Numa</hi>, Vet. Kalend. Rom. ap. Grut. 133; cf. so Laur. Lyd. de Mens. 4, 92.</sense></entryFree>
mercedula: <entryFree id="n28767" type="main" key="merce_du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēdŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. merces</etym>. <sense id="n28767.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Small wages, poor pay</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">infimi homines mercedula adducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto modo nec medico quicquam debere te nisi mercedulam dicis nec praeceptori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28767.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hire, rent, income</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere mercedulas praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mercenarius: <entryFree id="n28768" type="main" key="merce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēnārĭus</orth> (in old MSS. written mercennarius), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does any thing for reward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pay; hired for money, wages</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pay; paid, hired, mercenary</hi> (opp. to gratuitus, without pay, gratuitous). </sense><sense id="n28768.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28768.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes,</quote> <trans><tr>hired, bribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28768.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">mercenaria arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas gratuitane est, an mercenaria?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla mercenariae stipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 172</bibl></cit>: vincla, <hi rend="ital">his hireling fetters</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his salaried office of</hi> praeco, <hi rend="ital">which kept him confined</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 67</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28768.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mercēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hireling, hired servant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus mercenarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non male praecipiunt, qui ita jubent uti servis, ut mercenariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illiberales et sordidi quaestus mercenariorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oppionici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus perpetuus mercenarius est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eye-server</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:22:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merces: <entryFree id="n28769" type="main" key="merces1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merces</orth>, <itype>ēdis</itype> (<sense id="n28769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreg. acc.</hi> mercem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 6</bibl>; Cons. Hon. 578), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mereo, what is deserved or earned; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">hire, pay, wages, salary, fee, reward</hi>, etc. (syn.: pretium, stipendium; class.). </sense><sense id="n28769.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manuum mercede inopiam tolerare,</quote> <trans><tr>the wages of manual labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ars tanta abduceretur ad mercedem atque quaestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterum officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti ab Arvernis Sequanisque Germani mercede arcesserentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec merces erat dialecticorum,</quote> <trans><tr>fee</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonius cum mercede doceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedibus scenicorum recisis,</quote> <trans><tr>the players' salaries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscere mercedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to work for hire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcienda vestimenta mercede certa accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:205" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 205</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus est operarius mercede suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28769.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an unrighteous reward, a bribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio atque mercede minuere majestatem rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:20:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā mercede pacisci cum aliquo, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 33</bibl></cit>: mercedem accipere <cb n="MERC" /> ab aliquo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua adstricta mercede,</quote> <trans><tr>tied with a bribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 13.—</sense><sense id="n28769.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28769.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A price</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">reward, wages; recompense, punishment; cost, injury, detriment; a stipulation, condition</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem alicujus rei constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui rei imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces sanguinis atque laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:164" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:42" default="NO">1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare,</quote> <trans><tr>to demand payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:157, v. 158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 157, v. 158</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā mercede duas res adsequi,</quote> <trans><tr>to kill two birds with one stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliā bibam Mercede,</quote> <trans><tr>condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatis merces,</quote> <trans><tr>punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui metit mercedem accipit,</quote> <trans><tr>reward</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in molestiā gaudeo, te eam fidem cognoscere hominum non ita magnā mercede, quam ego maximo dolore cognōram,</quote> <trans><tr>price, cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine magnā mercede,</quote> <trans><tr>not except at great cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum illa mercede parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:273" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā quidem res tuas mercede colui,</quote> <trans><tr>to my great disadvantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28769.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rent, revenue, income, interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedes Argileti et Aventini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotalium praediorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedes habitationum annuae,</quote> <trans><tr>house-rents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanos tertiā mercedum parte relevavit,</quote> <trans><tr>farm-rent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: quinas hic capiti mercedes exsecat, <hi rend="ital">interest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discount on capital</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28770" type="main" key="merces2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merces</orth>, <itype>for merx</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
mercimonium: <entryFree id="n28771" type="main" key="merci^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>merx</etym>, <sense id="n28771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goods, wares, merchandise</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in vostris mercimoniis Emundis vendundisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agit meum mercimonium apud te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: videre cupio nostrum mercimonium, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tabernas, quibus id mercimonium inerat, quo flamma alitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merco: <entryFree id="n28772" type="main" key="merco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merco</orth>, <itype>are</itype>, v. mercor <sense id="n28772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mercor: <entryFree id="n28773" type="main" key="mercor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mercor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (archaic form, mercassitur for mercatus fuerit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 512, 20</bibl>.—<sense id="n28773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Inf.</hi> mercarier for mercari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 24</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to trade, traffic, deal in commodities</hi> (<hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 82</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to buy, purchase</hi> something from a person (cf. nundinor). </sense><sense id="n28773.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi>, with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the price (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum de pupillo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tanto pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos egregiasque domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti mercatura mullum luxuria?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 18, 31, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (segetem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 143</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mercans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">subst., a buyer, purchaser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem mercantium frustrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28773.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego haec officia mercanda vitā puto,</quote> <trans><tr>to be purchased with life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 15.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">to be bought</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam quidem facta emplastra mercantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 108</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mercātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">bought, purchased</hi>: commeatibus mercatis, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertiis centum quinquaginta milibus trullam unam mercatam a matrefamilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 29</bibl></cit> (the better reading is mercatā matre, Jan.).</sense></entryFree>
mercurialis: <entryFree id="n28774" type="main" key="Mercu^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercŭrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Mercurius</etym>, <sense id="n28774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the god Mercury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caduceum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 262</bibl></cit>: unde frequentia Mercuriale Imposuere mihi cognomen compita, <hi rend="ital">called me Mercury</hi> (as being a skilful man of business), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercŭrĭāles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a corporation of traders</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercuriales M. Furium Flaccum de collegio ejecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—With reference to Mercury as the god of scholars: <cit><quote lang="la">Faunus, Mercurialium Custos virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28774.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the planet Mercury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28774.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28774.3" n="A" level="2"> Herba mercurialis, <hi rend="ital">a plant, dog's-mercury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28774.4" n="B" level="2"> Pagus Mercurialis, <hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Africa propria, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Zeugitana, Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Erud. Antiq. p. 191.</sense></entryFree>
mercuriolus: <entryFree id="n28775" type="main" key="Mercu^ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercŭrĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> <cb n="MERE" /> <hi rend="ital">image of Mercury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 314, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">315, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mercurius: <entryFree id="n28776" type="main" key="Mercu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mercŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ermh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n28776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mercury, the son of Jupiter and Maia, the messenger of the gods; as a herald, the god of dexterity; in speaking, of eloquence; the bestower of prosperity; the god of traders and thieves; the presider over roads, and conductor of departed souls to the Lower World</hi>: Mercurius a mercibus est dictus. Hunc etenim negotiorum omnium aestimabant esse deum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:663" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 663</bibl> sqq.: stella Mercurii, <hi rend="ital">the planet Mercury</hi>: infra hanc autem stella Mercurii est, ea <foreign lang="greek">sti/lbwn</foreign> appellatur a Graecis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 54</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">stella Mercurii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also simply Mercurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies Mercurii or Mercuris,</quote> <trans><tr>Wednesday</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 402, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Appel. gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercuriorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n28776.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the withers</hi> of draught-cattle, between the neck and the back (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28776.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n28776.3" n="A" level="2"> Aqua Mercurii, <hi rend="ital">a fountain in the</hi> via Appia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:673" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 673</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28776.4" n="B" level="2"> Tumulus Mercurii, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Carthago nova, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28776.5" n="C" level="2"> Promontorium Mercurii, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Africa, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Zeugitana, <hi rend="ital">near Carthage</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Bon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merda: <entryFree id="n28777" type="main" key="merda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">moru/ssein</foreign>, to defile</etym>, <sense id="n28777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dung, ordure, excrement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:17:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merdaceus: <entryFree id="n28778" type="main" key="merda_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merdācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merda</etym>, <sense id="n28778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defiled with excrement</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 69, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 3, 160, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merdaleus: <entryFree id="n28779" type="main" key="merda_le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merdālĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, = merdaceus, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 68, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
mere: <entryFree id="n28780" type="main" key="me^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. merus <sense id="n28780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
merenda: <entryFree id="n28781" type="main" key="me^renda1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrenda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mereo, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n28781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an afternoon luncheon</hi>, taken between four and five o'clock (ante- and post-class.): merendam antiqui dicebant pro prandio, quod scilicet medio die caperetur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">merenda dicitur cibus post meridiem qui datur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 49</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serae hora merendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:60" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 12</bibl>.—Also of <hi rend="ital">feed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">medicine for a beast</hi>: Cyprio bovi merendam, Ennius cum dixit, significat id, quod solet fieri in insulā Cypro, in quā boves humano stercore pascuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59</bibl> Müll. (sola, v. 2 Vahl. p. 164).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28782" type="main" key="Merenda2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Merenda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: T. Antonius Merenda, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, A. U. C. 304, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merendarius: <entryFree id="n28783" type="main" key="me^renda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrendārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. merenda</etym>, <sense id="n28783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes an afternoon luncheon</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub. (al. mercenarios).</sense></entryFree>
merendo: <entryFree id="n28784" type="main" key="me^rendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrendo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take an afternoon luncheon</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">merenda est cibus, qui declinante die sumitur, quasi post meridiem edenda: Hinc merendare, quasi meridie edere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merens: <entryFree id="n28785" type="main" key="me^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of mereo, q. v.</entryFree>
mereo: <entryFree id="n28786" type="main" key="me^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/ros, mei/romai, mo/ros</foreign>, etc.; hence, to receive one's share; cf. II. below</etym>, <sense id="n28786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deserve, merit, to be entitled to, be worthy of</hi> a thing; constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n28786.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n28786.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mereri praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minimum decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">favorem aut odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam nullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:9:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 9, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:532" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondit, sese meruisse, ut decoraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mereri, ne quis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae merui vitio perdere cuncta meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:11:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctus haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem meam, si mereor, tuearis,</quote> <trans><tr>if I deserve it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">meruisse supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 666</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n28786.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To earn, gain, get, obtain, acquire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid meres? quantillo argenti te conduxit Pseudulus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 95</bibl></cit>: iste, qui meret HS. vicenos, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 296</bibl>: non amplius duodecim aeris, Cic. <pb n="1136" /> <cb n="MERE" /> Rosc. Com. 10, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">ne minus gratiae praecipiendo recta quam offensae reprendendo prava mereamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen patronorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgentiam, principis ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen gloriamque merere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillā natus diadema Quirini meruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:260" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum quisque uno die mereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 345</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (rare): quem ego ut non excruciem, alterum tantum auri non meream, <hi rend="ital">would not give up torturing him for</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 65</bibl>: neque ille sibi mereat Persarum montes ... ut istuc faciat, <hi rend="ital">would not do it for</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28786.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To get by purchase, to buy, purchase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores, quae vos dote meruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid arbitramini Rheginos merere velle, ut ab eis marmorea Venus illa auferatur?</quote> <trans><tr>what do you think they would take? for what price would they let it be carried away?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum a creditore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Minyae meruere queri?</quote> <trans><tr>to have reason, cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:519" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 519</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.9" n="C" level="2"> In milit. lang., mereri and merere stipendia, or simply merere (lit., to earn pay), <hi rend="ital">to serve for pay, to serve as a soldier, serve in the army</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mereri stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meruit stipendia in eo bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens patre suo imperatore meruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triennio sub Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Thracia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merere equo,</quote> <trans><tr>to serve on horseback, in the cavalry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merere pedibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to serve on foot, in the infantry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18</bibl></cit>: mereri aere (al. equo) publico, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 345, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.10" n="D" level="2"> Mereri (ante-class., merere) de aliquo, or de aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to deserve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merit</hi> any thing of one, <hi rend="ital">to behave</hi> in any manner towards one, in a good or bad sense (in Plaut. also with erga): <cit><quote lang="la">te ego, ut digna es, perdam, atque ut de me meres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut erga me est merita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam de te neque re neque verbis merui, ut faceres quod facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: saepe (erga me; <cit><quote lang="la">sc. illam) meritam quod vellem scio,</quote> <trans><tr>that she has often treated me as I desired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: bene, male, optime, etc., mereri, <hi rend="ital">to deserve well, ill</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">de mendico male meretur, qui ei dat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā bene mereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de populi Romani nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius de quibusdam acerbos inimicos mereri, quam eos amicos, qui dulces videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publica meruisse optime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciosius de re publicā merentur vitiosi principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stet haec urbs praeclara, quoquo modo merita de me erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulus, qui nihil meruit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was innocent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se omni tempore de populo Romano meritos esse, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem imperatorem bene de republicā meritum,</quote> <trans><tr>deserving well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime cum de se meritum judicabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites mirifice de re publicā meriti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines de me divinitus meriti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te ego ut digna's perdam atque ut de me meres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n28786.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., that deserves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merits</hi> any thing; in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">deserving;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">guilty; that has rendered himself deserving</hi> towards any one or of any thing; with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.;</hi> esp. with bene, <hi rend="ital">well-deserving</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consul laudare, increpare merentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea decreta merenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:91" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: quem periisse, ita de re publicā merentem, doleo, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 344, 23</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 933, 5</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando tu me bene merentem tibi habes despicatui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: HOMINI BENE MERENTISSIMO, Inscr. Rein. cl. 16, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 932, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1129, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.12" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n28786.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Deserving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meriti juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 515</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: filiae meritissimae, Inscr. Rein. cl. 5, 35. —</sense><sense id="n28786.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., deserved, due, fit, just, proper, right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignarus, laus an poena merita esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam, neque eam injustam, sed meritam ac debitam fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>just</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A 4, 696</bibl></cit>: noxia, <hi rend="ital">committed, perpetrated</hi>,<cb n="MERE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: meritis de causis, <hi rend="ital">for merited</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">just reasons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famā optimā et meritissimā frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28786.15" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28786.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">That which one deserves, desert;</hi> in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">reward, recompense;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> (only ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil suave meritum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specta denique, quale caelesti providentia meritum reportaverit,</quote> <trans><tr>reward, punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">That by which one deserves</hi> any thing of another, <hi rend="ital">a merit;</hi> esp. in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">a service, kindness, benefit, favor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propter eorum (militum) divinum atque immortale meritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro singulari eorum merito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo tuorum erga me meritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et hercule merito tuo feci,</quote> <trans><tr>according to your merits, as you deserved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro ingentibus meritis praemia acceperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatio ingentium meritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 49, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 8, 2</bibl>.—In Plaut. also in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritissimo ejus, quae volet faciemus,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of his great merit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merita dare et recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna ejus sunt in me non dico officia, sed merita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">demerit, blame, fault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar, qui a me nullo meo merito alienus esse debebat,</quote> <trans><tr>without any fault of mine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo meo in se merito,</quote> <trans><tr>although I am guilty of no offence against him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter, ex merito quicquid patiare, ferendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex cujusque merito scio me fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam punivit, alios praemiis adfecit, neutrum ex merito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ob meritum nostrum succensuistis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">worth, value, importance</hi> of a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo sit merito quaeque notata dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: aedificia majoris meriti, <hi rend="ital">of greater value</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:65:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 65, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi saporis mella thymi sucus effundit, secundi meriti thymbra, tertii meriti rosmarinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.19" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., according to desert, deservedly, justly</hi>, often connected with jure (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam merito sum iratus Metello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68:section=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merito ac jure laudantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipse jure optimo, merito incuses, licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte ac merito commovebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merito jam suspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:208" default="NO">10, 208</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: meritissimo te magni facio, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me deridere meritissumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl>; S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 6</bibl>; ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9</bibl>.—Post-class.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">meritissime</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28786.20" n="b" level="4"> In partic.: libens (lubens) merito, a form of expression used in paying vows; v. libens, under libet.</sense></entryFree>
mereor: <entryFree id="n28787" type="main" key="me^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus</itype>, v. 2. mereo.</entryFree>
