meretricabilis: <entryFree id="n28788" type="main" key="me^re^tri_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĕtrīcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĕtrī-cārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>meretrix</etym>, = meretricius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Amic. 22, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. § 55.</entryFree>
meretricie: <entryFree id="n28789" type="main" key="me^re_^tri_ci^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē^trīcĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. meretricius <sense id="n28789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
meretricius: <entryFree id="n28790" type="main" key="me^re_^tri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē^trīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>meretrix</etym>, <sense id="n28790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to harlots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prostitutes, meretricious</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28790.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meretricia ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>a courtesan's house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28790.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē^trīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n28790.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The art of a courtesan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inmutari blandimentis, hortamentis, ceteris meretriciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28790.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The trade of a harlot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē^trīcĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of harlots, meretriciously</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">digne ornata, haud meretricie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meretricor: <entryFree id="n28791" type="gloss" key="me^re^tri_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĕtrīcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deal with harlots</hi>: meretricor <foreign lang="greek">e(taireu/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
meretricula: <entryFree id="n28792" type="main" key="me^re_^tri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē^trīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public prostitute, courtesan</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meretricula Leontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meretrix: <entryFree id="n28793" type="main" key="me^re_^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē^trix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype> (<sense id="n28793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> meretricium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 435</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mereo; she who earns moncy; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a prostitute, harlot</hi>, <cb n="MERG" /> <hi rend="ital">courtesan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt hic meretrices omnes elecebrae argentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricem indigne deperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proterva meretrix procaxque, Cic Cael. 20, 49: meretrix inter multos se dividit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat meretrix certo cuivis mercabilis aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusta, i. e. Messalina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina, i. e. Cleopatra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mergae: <entryFree id="n28794" type="main" key="mergae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root marg-, to clear away; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">a)me/rgw, a)me/lgw</foreign>, mulgo, amurca</etym>, <sense id="n28794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a two-pronged pitchfork</hi>, with which corn, when cut, was made into heaps: <cit><quote lang="la">mergae furculae, quibus acervi frugum fiunt, dictae a volucribus mergis, quia, ut illi se in aquam mergunt, dum pisces persequuntur, sic messores eas in fruges demergunt, ut elevare possint manipulos, Paul. ex Fest, p. 124 Müll.: mergas datus, ut hortum fodiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi mergis, alii pectinibus spicam ipsam legunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">si attigeris ostium, jam tibi hercle in ore fiet messio mergis pugneis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a rich crop of fisticuffs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merges: <entryFree id="n28795" type="hapax" key="merge^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mergae</etym>. <sense id="n28795.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sheaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerealis mergite culmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 517</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n28795.1" n="II" level="1"> I. q. mergae, <hi rend="ital">a two-pronged pitchfork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 296</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mergito: <entryFree id="n28796" type="hapax" key="mergi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n28796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [mergo], <hi rend="ital">to dip in, immerse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter mergitamur, i. e. baptizamur (al. mersitamur),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Cor. Milit. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mergo: <entryFree id="n28797" type="main" key="mergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. madsh-, majan, to dip; Zend, masga, marrow; Germ. Mark; Engl. marrow</etym>, <sense id="n28797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip, dip in, immerse; absol</hi>. also <hi rend="ital">to plunge into water, to sink</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28797.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eos (pullos) mergi in aquam jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, quae se in mari mergunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 49, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putealibus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:391" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygia undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia indomitis merge sub aequoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:80" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc (the sword-fish) perfossas naves mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersa navis omnes destituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersa carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum coepisset mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in immensam altitudinem mergi, ac sine ulla respirandi vice perpeti maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Dial. 4:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Dial. 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars maxima classis mergitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:753 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 753 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me deus aequore mersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:948" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 948</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 753</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter matutino Tiberi mergetur,</quote> <trans><tr>bathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:523" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 523</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of overwhelming waters, <hi rend="ital">to engulf, swallow up, overwhelm</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic te mersuras adjuvet ignis aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:340" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersa rate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:302" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 302</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28797.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28797.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sink down, sink in, to plunge, thrust</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drive in, to fix in</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">palmitem per jugum mergere, et alligare,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust, push</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad Styga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1007" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1007</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum in ora (ursae),</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:19:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersisque in corpore rostris Dilacerant (canes) falsi dominum sub imagine cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 249</bibl></cit>: fluvius in Euphratem mergitur, <hi rend="ital">runs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">empties into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 128</bibl>: visceribus ferrum. <hi rend="ital">to thrust into</hi>, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 447</bibl>.—Of heavenly bodies, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bootes, Qui vix sero alto mergitur Oceano,</quote> <trans><tr>sinks into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28797.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to hide, conceal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersitque suos in cortice vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1348" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem or lucem, of the setting of the sun,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 771" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra caelum mergens, i. e. occidentalis, because there the sky seems to sink into the sea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 54</bibl></cit>. —Of those on board a vessel: mergere Pelion et templum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to sail away from until they sink below the horizon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28797.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to plunge into, sink, overwhelm, cover, bury, immerse, drown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funere acerbo,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring to a painful death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi in voluptates,</quote> <trans><tr>to plunge into, yield one's self up to sensual delights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergit longa atque insignis honorum pagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 57</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander mersus secundis rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>overwhelmed with prosperity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino somnoque mersi jacent,</quote> <trans><tr>dead drunk and buried in sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 159</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:66" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mergeretur somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of those whose fortune is <hi rend="ital">swallowed up</hi> in debts or debauchery: mersus foro, <hi rend="ital">bankrupt</hi>, Plaut <pb n="1137" /> <cb n="MERI" /> Ep. 1, 2, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">aere paterno Ac rebus mersis in ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censum domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 31, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergentibus sortem usuris,</quote> <trans><tr>sinking, destroying his capital</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mergantur pupilli,</quote> <trans><tr>be robbed of their fortune, ruined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersis fer opem rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>bring aid to utter distress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 380</bibl></cit>.—Of drinking to excess: <cit><quote lang="la">potatio quae mergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mergulus: <entryFree id="n28798" type="gloss" key="mergu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mergo</etym>, <sense id="n28798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wick of a lamp</hi>: mergulus, <foreign lang="greek">e)llu/xnion</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. and Lat.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28799" type="main" key="mergu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mergus</etym>, <sense id="n28799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diver, a kind of bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 14, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mergus: <entryFree id="n28800" type="main" key="mergus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mergus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mergo</etym>. <sense id="n28800.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A diver</hi>, a kind of water-fowl, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=78" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 78</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagiunt pluviam mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi maria fugientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 625</bibl>; cf.: aequor amat; <cit><quote lang="la">nomenque tenet, quia mergitur illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:795" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 795</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:22" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 22</bibl>.—Jestingly: <cit><quote lang="la">mergus agrarius, of one who is eager to possess lands,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28800.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vine-layer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meribibulus: <entryFree id="n28801" type="main" key="me^ri^bi^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭbĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merumbibulus</etym>, <sense id="n28801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine-bibbing</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merica: <entryFree id="n28802" type="main" key="merica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merica</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moer-</orth>), sc. vitis or uva, <sense id="n28802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of vine</hi>, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2</bibl>. 4, § 35 (al. metica; Jan. mettica).</sense></entryFree>
meridialis: <entryFree id="n28803" type="main" key="me^ri_di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>meridies</etym>, <sense id="n28803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of midday</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventus (al. meridionalis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meridianus: <entryFree id="n28804" type="main" key="me^ri_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mid-day, mid-day-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28804.1" n="I" level="1"> (Class.) Tempus, <hi rend="ital">mid-day, noon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 9, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕ-rīdĭāni</orth>, sc. gladiatores, <hi rend="ital">mid-day combatants, gladiators who fought at mid-day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">abl. adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭā-nō</orth>, sc. tempore, <hi rend="ital">at mid-day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28804.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the south</hi> or <hi rend="ital">south side, southern, southerly, meridional</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager spectat ad meridianam caeli partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars orbis, opp. septentrionalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <trans><tr>the equator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus tabernaculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the south</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 34, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 8, 26</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">southern places</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in meridianis Indiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meridiatio: <entryFree id="n28805" type="hapax" key="me^ri_di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>meridio</etym>, <sense id="n28805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a midday nap, siesta</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et lucubrationes detraxi, et meridiationes addidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68, 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meridies: <entryFree id="n28806" type="main" key="me^ri_di^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 9</bibl>) [for medidies from medius-dies], <sense id="n28806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mid-day, noon</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meridies ab eo, quod medius dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 4</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum meridiem cur non medidiem? credo, quod erat insuavius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 551</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante meridiem, post meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem diffindere insiticio somno meridie,</quote> <trans><tr>to take a nap at noon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclamare horam esse tertiam, itemque meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 89</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n28806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28806.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The south</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflectens sol cursum tum ad septentriones, tum ad meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a meridie Aegyptus objacet, ab occasu Phoenices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28806.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the middle</hi> of a given time (ante- and postclass.): noctis circiter meridiem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 451, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meridio: <entryFree id="n28807" type="main" key="me^ri_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>meridies</etym>, <sense id="n28807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take a mid-day nap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">siesta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube, ad te veniam meridiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meridiari ante cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ea meridiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter acervos eorum meridiati sunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have taken their ease</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 24, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meridionalis: <entryFree id="n28808" type="main" key="me^ri_di^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern, meridional</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. meridiana): signum, Firm. Math. 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>
meridionarius: <entryFree id="n28809" type="main" key="me^ri_di^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrīdĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mid-day, meridional</hi> (postclass.): gloria quoius lemulcatus (lemniscatus) meridionaria, Tit. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Orthogr. p. 130</bibl> Mai. <cb n="MERO" /></sense></entryFree>
merinas: <entryFree id="n28810" type="main" key="Meri_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Merīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <sense id="n28810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Merinum, in Apulia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Merinates ex Gargano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meriones: <entryFree id="n28811" type="main" key="Me_ri^o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mērĭŏnes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mhrio/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n28811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charioteer of Idomeneus, who piloted his ships from Crete to Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meritissime: <entryFree id="n28812" type="main" key="me^ri^tissi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtissĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mō</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mereo <sense id="n28812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
merito: <entryFree id="n28813" type="main" key="me^ri^to_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mereo <sense id="n28813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28814" type="main" key="me^ri^to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>mereo</etym>. * <sense id="n28814.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To earn, gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus, qui sestertia dena meritāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roscius histrio HS. D. annua meritāsse proditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28814.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To serve for pay, to serve as a soldier, be a soldier</hi>: meritavere Cato ait pro meruere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=152" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 152</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculas meritare per oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:656" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 656</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meritorius: <entryFree id="n28815" type="main" key="me^ri^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the earning of money, by which money is earned, for which money is paid, that brings in money</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n28815.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutatio,</quote> <trans><tr>by which one hopes to obtain money, interested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in meritorio stabulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28815.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtōria</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">places</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rooms which are let out for a short time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:234" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 234</bibl>: facere, <hi rend="ital">to let out rooms for a short time</hi> (opp. locare, to rent by the year), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28815.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the earning of money by prostitution, that earns money by prostitution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28815.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtōrium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bawdy-house, brothel</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 6, 31.</sense></entryFree>
meritum: <entryFree id="n28816" type="main" key="me^ri^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. mereo <sense id="n28816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B. 1.</sense></entryFree>
meritus: <entryFree id="n28817" type="main" key="me^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from mereo, q. v. <sense id="n28817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
merkedonius: <entryFree id="n28818" type="main" key="merke_do^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merkēdŏnĭus</orth>, v. mercedonius.</entryFree>
mermeros: <entryFree id="n28819" type="main" key="Merme^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mermĕros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/rmeros</foreign>, <sense id="n28819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Centaurs present at the wedding of Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 305</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mermessius: <entryFree id="n28820" type="main" key="Mermessi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mermessĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Mermessus, in Phrygia, Mermessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid Mermessia dixit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Hellespontine Sibyl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit> (Müller, Marpesia).</sense></entryFree>
mero: <entryFree id="n28821" type="main" key="Me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>merum</etym>, <sense id="n28821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wine-bibber</hi>, a nickname bestowed on the emperor Tiberius Claudius Nero, in allusion to his drinking propensities: <cit><quote lang="la">propter nimiam vini aviditatem, pro Tiberio Biberius, pro Claudio Caldius, pro Nerone Mero vocabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merobibus: <entryFree id="n28822" type="hapax" key="me^ro_bi^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrōbĭbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merum-bibo</etym>, <sense id="n28822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that drinks wine unmixed</hi> (which among the ancients was the practice only of drunkards): <cit><quote lang="la">anus multibiba atque merobiba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
meroe: <entryFree id="n28823" type="main" key="Me^ro^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕrŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mero/h</foreign>, <sense id="n28823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large and celebrated island of the Nile, in Ethiopia</hi>, now the province of <hi rend="ital">Atbar</hi>, Mela, 1, 9, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:570" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:528" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 528</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a lusus verbb. with merum, of a tippling woman (cf. merobibus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕ-rŏētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Meroë, Meroëtic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebenus Meroëtica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 117</bibl></cit> Cort. (al. Mareotica).</sense></entryFree>
merois: <entryFree id="n28824" type="greek" key="me^ro^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrŏis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meroi/+s</foreign>, <sense id="n28824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant growing in Meroë</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merope: <entryFree id="n28825" type="main" key="Me^ro^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕrŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mero/ph</foreign>, <sense id="n28825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mythic name of several persons</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28825.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Atlas and Pleione, one of the Pleiades, whose star is more obscure than the rest, because she wedded Sisyphus, a mortal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:175" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 175</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n28825.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Sol and Clymene, and sister of Phaëthon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 152" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28825.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Megareus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 185" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merops: <entryFree id="n28826" type="main" key="Me^rops1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕrops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*me/roy</foreign>. <sense id="n28826.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Ethiopia, husband of Clymene, and reputed to be the father of Phaëthon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 763</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28826.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the isle of Cos, from whose name its inhabitants in early times were called</hi> Meropes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28826.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman proper name</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 887, 5.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28827" type="greek" key="me^rops2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/roy</foreign>, <sense id="n28827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird that devours bees;</hi> hence also called apiastra, <hi rend="ital">the bee-eater</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 99</bibl>. <cb n="MERU" /></sense></entryFree>
merosus: <entryFree id="n28828" type="hapax" key="me^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merus</etym>, <sense id="n28828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pure, unmixed</hi> (post-class.): vinum, Agroet. de Orthogr. p. 2273 P.</sense></entryFree>
mersio: <entryFree id="n28829" type="gloss" key="mersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mersĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mergo</etym>, <sense id="n28829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dipping in, immersion</hi>: mersio, <foreign lang="greek">bu/qisis</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
mersito: <entryFree id="n28830" type="main" key="mersi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mersĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip in, immerse</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nares in bibendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merso: <entryFree id="n28831" type="main" key="merso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n28831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip in, immerse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n28831.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">balantumque gregem fluvio mersare salubri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneo infertur, calida aqua mersatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28831.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overwhelm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum copia mersat,</quote> <trans><tr>drowns, destroys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1008" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1008</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersor civilibus undis,</quote> <trans><tr>plunge myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28831.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: mersari, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>, of the stars, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 844</bibl>; cf. merto.</sense></entryFree>
mersura: <entryFree id="n28832" type="main" key="Mersu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mersūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>merso</etym> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 54, 25</bibl>.</entryFree>
mersus: <entryFree id="n28833" type="main" key="mersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from mergo.</entryFree>
merthryx: <entryFree id="n28834" type="main" key="merthryx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merthryx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a false reading for myrtis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 68, § 108</bibl>.</entryFree>
merto: <entryFree id="n28835" type="main" key="merto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>mergo</etym>, a collat. form of merso, <sense id="n28835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to immerse, overwhelm</hi> (anteclass.): mertat pro mersat dicebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl>: quos hic non mertet metus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">138, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merula: <entryFree id="n28836" type="main" key="me^ru^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (post-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 13), <sense id="n28836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blackbird, ousel, merle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n28836.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolare merulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut merula, quia sola volat, quasi mera volans nominaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 42, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 30, 45, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 53, 74, § 147</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28836.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28836.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fish, the sea-carp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merulae virentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:114" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28836.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of hydraulic machine that produced a sound like the note of the blackbird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28837" type="main" key="Me^ru^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. </sense><sense id="n28837.1" n="A" level="2"> Cn. Cornelius Merula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 55</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n28837.2" n="B" level="2"> L. Cornelius Merula, flamen Dialis, Vel. 2, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 58, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28838" type="main" key="Me^ru^la3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
merulator: <entryFree id="n28839" type="gloss" key="me^ru^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mero</etym>, <sense id="n28839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a winedrinker</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 1442, 5.</sense></entryFree>
merulentus: <entryFree id="n28840" type="main" key="me^ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merum</etym>, <sense id="n28840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drunken, intoxicated</hi> (post-class.): Pierides, Fulg. Myth. praef.</sense></entryFree>
merulinus: <entryFree id="n28841" type="main" key="Me^ru^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕrŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Raym. Guarin. Comm. 7, p. 41.</sense></entryFree>
merulus: <entryFree id="n28842" type="main" key="me^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. merula <sense id="n28842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
merum: <entryFree id="n28843" type="main" key="me^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. merus, 2.</entryFree>
merus: <entryFree id="n28844" type="main" key="me^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root mar-, to gleam; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">ma/rmaros</foreign>, marmor, mare; hence, bright, pure</etym>, <sense id="n28844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pure, unmixed, unadulterated</hi>, esp. of wine not mixed with water: merum antiqui dicebant solum: at nunc merum purum appellamus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124</bibl> Müll. </sense><sense id="n28844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vinum merum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 295</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 331</bibl></cit>.—Of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:369" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claror,</quote> <trans><tr>clear, unclouded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero meridie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28844.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">pure, unmixed wine, wine not mixed with water</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ingurgitare se in merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 36, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">objecturus Antonio Cicero merum et vomitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meri veteris torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:319" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:283" default="NO">3, 283</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:595" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 595</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad merum pronior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 23, § 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28844.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28844.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bare, naked, uncovered</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 158</bibl></cit>: stabat calce merā, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 91.—</sense><sense id="n28844.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">bare, nothing but, only, mere</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meri bellatores gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio (foro) ostentatores meri (ambulant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: Diogenem postea pallium solum habuisse, et habere Ulixem meram tunicam, <hi rend="ital">nothing but, only</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 344, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil, nisi spem meram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mera monstra nuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptiones, meri Sullae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera loquuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28844.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pure, true, real, genuine, unadulterated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meri principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl></cit>: velut ex diutinā siti nimis avide meram haurientes libertatem, <hi rend="ital">immoderate, excessive</hi>, Liv. <pb n="1138" /> <cb n="MESO" /> 39, 26; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl>; but mera libertas, in Horace, signifies <hi rend="ital">true, genuine freedom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaia, illa vera et mera Graecia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cecropis,</quote> <trans><tr>a real Athenian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 187</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">purely, without mixture, wholly, entirely</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">si semel amoris poculum accepit mere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
merx: <entryFree id="n28845" type="main" key="merx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">merx</orth>, <itype>cis</itype> (<sense id="n28845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> merces, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 27</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mereo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">goods, wares, commodities, merchandise</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">invendibili merce oportet ultro emptorem adducere: Proba merx facile emptorem reperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallaces et fucosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrina et delicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineae,</quote> <trans><tr>for women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esculenta,</quote> <trans><tr>eatables, victuals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem mercibus implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:288" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta quoque in merce sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are an article of merchandise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabiae et Indiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercis sordidae negotiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peculiari merce negotiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:72" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28845.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a thing</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n28845.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">mala merx haec, et callida est,</quote> <trans><tr>a bad lot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 56</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi ego illas malas merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mercis malae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28845.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aetas mala mala'st merces tergo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (in old MSS. for merx also <orth extent="full" lang="la">mers</orth> is written acc. to Ritschl; v. Rhein. Mus. 10, p. 454 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
mesa: <entryFree id="n28846" type="greek" key="me^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/sh</foreign>, <sense id="n28846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">middle</hi>, pure Lat. media (post-Aug.).—Of hemp: <cit><quote lang="la">tria ejus (cannabis) genera: laudatissima est e medio, quae mesa vocatur,</quote> <trans><tr>the middle sort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 174</bibl></cit>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsancŭlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsancŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>), = <foreign lang="greek">mesa/gkulon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a javelin, with a thong</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a poise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bent handle</hi>) <hi rend="ital">attached to the middle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25</bibl>; cf.: mesanculum, teli missilis genus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
mesapia: <entryFree id="n28847" type="main" key="Mesa_pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mesāpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Messapia.</entryFree>
mesapius: <entryFree id="n28848" type="main" key="Mesa_pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mesāpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Messapius.</entryFree>
mesapus: <entryFree id="n28849" type="main" key="Mesa_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mesāpus</orth>, v. Messapus.</entryFree>
mesauloe: <entryFree id="n28850" type="greek" key="mesauloe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mesauloe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/sauloi</foreign>.—In archit., <sense id="n28850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">narrow passages between two rooms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">walls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duo autem peristylia itinera sunt, quae mesauloe dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit> (10), 5; cf. andron.</sense></entryFree>
mese: <entryFree id="n28851" type="greek" key="me^se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/sh</foreign>, <sense id="n28851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the middle note, the note</hi> A, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesembria: <entryFree id="n28852" type="main" key="Me^sembri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsembrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meshmbri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thrace, on the Black Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Missiori</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 45</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsembrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Mesembrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesene: <entryFree id="n28853" type="main" key="Me^se_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mesh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n28853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the midland, a name of the district of Babylonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
meses: <entryFree id="n28854" type="greek" key="me^ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕses</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/shs</foreign>, <sense id="n28854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the northnortheast wind, between</hi> boreas <hi rend="ital">and</hi> caecias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesobrachys: <entryFree id="n28855" type="greek" key="me^so^bra^chys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏbrăchys</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meso/braxus</foreign> (sc. pes), <sense id="n28855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical foot of five syllables, of which only the middle one is short</hi> (e. g. pulcherrĭmarum; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to mesomacros),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 479</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
mesochorus: <entryFree id="n28856" type="greek" key="me^so^cho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏchŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meso/xoros</foreign>, <sense id="n28856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who stands in the middle of a chorus</hi> (of dancers or singers) <hi rend="ital">to lead it, a chorusleader</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum mesochorus dedit signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesogites: <entryFree id="n28857" type="main" key="Me^so^gi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsŏgītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of wine from Mesogis</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Messogis</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a mountain of Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesoides: <entryFree id="n28858" type="greek" key="me^so^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mesoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n28858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical modulation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mesoides, quae tonos aequales, mediosque custodit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 965 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
mesolabium: <entryFree id="n28859" type="greek" key="me^so^la^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏlăbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mesola/bion</foreign>, <sense id="n28859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mathematical instrument for finding mean proportional lines, a mesolabe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesoleucos: <entryFree id="n28860" type="greek" key="me^so^leucos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏleucos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meso/leukos</foreign>. <sense id="n28860.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A black precious stone with a white stripe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28860.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 77, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesomacros: <entryFree id="n28861" type="greek" key="me^so^ma^cros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏmăcros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meso/makros</foreign> (sc. pes), <sense id="n28861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical foot of five syllables</hi>, <cb n="MESS" /> <hi rend="ital">of which only the middle one is long</hi> (e. g. avidissimus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. mesobrachys),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
mesomelas: <entryFree id="n28862" type="greek" key="me^so^me^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏmĕlas</orth>, <itype>ănos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mesome/las</foreign>, <sense id="n28862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white precious stone with a black stripe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesonauta: <entryFree id="n28863" type="greek" key="me^so^nauta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏnauta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mesonau/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n28863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaman who ranked between the pilot and the rowers</hi>, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Dig. 4, 9, 1, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesonyctius: <entryFree id="n28864" type="main" key="me^so^nycti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsŏnyctĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">mesonu/ktios</foreign>, <sense id="n28864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of midnight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">† mĕsŏnyctĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mesonu/ktion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">midnight</hi> (post-class.): CVIVS MESONYCTIVM FACTVM EST V. ID. DEC., i. e. <hi rend="ital">midnight apparition</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 333.</sense></entryFree>
mesopotamia: <entryFree id="n28865" type="main" key="Me^so^po^ta^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsŏpŏtămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mesopotami/a</foreign>, <sense id="n28865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Asia, between the Euphrates and Tigris</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">Al-Jezireh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 13, 21, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 51</bibl> Dietsch. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsŏpŏtămĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsŏpŏtămēnus</orth>), <hi rend="ital">Mesopotamian</hi> (post-class.): milites, Val. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mesopotameni homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĕsŏpŏ-tămēsii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Mesopotamians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 21, 12</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 104</bibl>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">mesŏpylus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/sospu/lh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">that is at the middle door</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 32, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mesosphaerum: <entryFree id="n28866" type="greek" key="me^sosphaerum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕsosphaerum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">meso/sfairon</foreign>, <sense id="n28866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of nard with middle-sized leaves</hi> (v. hadrosphaerum and microsphaerum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mespilum: <entryFree id="n28867" type="greek" key="mespi^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mespĭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">me/spilon</foreign>. <sense id="n28867.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A medlar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 20, 22, § 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 19</bibl> and 22.—</sense><sense id="n28867.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A medlar-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mespilus: <entryFree id="n28868" type="greek" key="mespi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mespĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mespĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mespi/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n28868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medlar-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 13, § 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28868.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A medlar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> de Insit. 69</bibl> and 105.</sense></entryFree>
messala: <entryFree id="n28869" type="main" key="Messa_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Messāla</orth>, v. Messalla.</entryFree>
messalina: <entryFree id="n28870" type="main" key="Messa_li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Messālīna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Messallīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n28870.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The profligate wife of the emperor Claudius, daughter of</hi> M. Valerius Messalla Barbatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:333" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 333</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:116 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 116 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n28870.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of the emperor Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
